0.title: Tesla to pay salary for 3 months to Ukrainian employees called to fight Russia
0.article_body: Elon Musk-led Tesla will pay its Ukrainian employees, who are asked to return to Ukraine to defend their country following the Russian invasion, for at least three months, according to a company e-mail seen by CNBC. The e-mail was sent to Tesla employees in Europe, the Middle East and Africa region. Tesla will reassess the situation in three months.

1.title: I did 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for experience with Bhansali: Alia
1.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that she did the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for the experience with filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali. She further said she has wanted to work with him since she was nine years old, adding she was fulfilling that childhood dream. "As a little girl and as an actor, it's the most grateful I've ever felt," Alia said.

2.title: Woman falls between moving train & platform, gets rescued by police
2.article_body: A female passenger fell between a train and a platform while trying to leave a moving train in Maharashtra, the Free Press Journal reported. A video of the incident shows the woman being immediately rescued by Head Constable Anil Upadhyay, who was seen dragging her towards him. The passenger explained that she jumped in 'panic' after boarding the wrong train.

3.title: 8 new police stations set up in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas
3.article_body: Eight new police stations have been formed in the Barrackpore Police Commissionerate area in North 24 Parganas district by the West Bengal government, an official said. He added that while Dakshineswar was formed out of Belghoria and Baranagar police station areas, the Nagerbazar police station was carved out of Dumdum. Naihati saw the formation of Shibdaspur and Halisahar police stations.

4.title: BJP crosses halfway mark, to retain power for 2nd consecutive term in Uttarakhand
4.article_body: BJP will retain power for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after the party crossed the halfway mark of 35 seats in the state Assembly election. However, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has lost to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri from the Khatima assembly seat. Congress has currently secured victory in 15 assembly seats and is leading in four.

5.title: CSK share pictures from Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony
5.article_body: CSK took to Twitter to share pictures from cricketer Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony. Rahul, who is the cousin brother of CSK's Deepak Chahar, got married to his longtime girlfriend Ishani on Wednesday. "When Deepak brought out the Yellove in Rahul!" CSK captioned the pictures. Rahul was part of India's T20 World Cup squad.

6.title: Thumping majority seal of people's faith in PM Modi's policies: UP CM Yogi
6.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted, "Dedicated to good governance, security and nationalism, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance, the historic victory of BJP alliance in UP has been ensured." He added, "This thumping majority is a seal of unwavering faith of the common people on the policies of the PM."  BJP alliance won 135 seats and is leading on 137 seats.

7.title: Cong needs self-introspection: Party MP on Assembly poll results
7.article_body: Reacting to Assembly poll results in five states, Congress Lok Sabha MP Benny Behanan said that party needs to introspect on its performance. "Congress must now learn from...failure of this election [and]...unification of anti-BJP votes in all states...should be led by Congress," he added. Congress will face challenges if it doesn't prepare itself to act on reality, Behanan further said.

8.title: Will go with Kumble-Harbhajan over Ashwin-Jadeja: Karim on spin-pairing
8.article_body: Asked to choose between spin-bowling pair of Anil Kumble-Harbhajan Singh and Ravichandran Ashwin-Ravindra Jadeja, Saba Karim said he will choose the former. "I feel that era was more challenging. In today's era...cricket is evolving but the standard of batting has fallen against spin," he added. Kumble-Harbhajan scalped 501 wickets in 54 Tests, while Ashwin-Jadeja have 424 wickets in 42 Tests.

9.title: Pic shows injured pregnant woman being rescued after Russian strike hit hospital
9.article_body: An image shows an injured pregnant woman being rescued from the rubble after a Russian strike on a Ukrainian maternity hospital. The attack in Mariupol, which is reported to have left at least 17 people wounded, has been branded an "atrocity" by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Three people, including a child, were killed in the attack, reported local media citing officials.

10.title: Proud to be Bhagyashree's daughter, but here to make my name: Avantika
10.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani in an interview has said that she is proud to be actress Bhagyashree's daughter but she is here to make her own name and identity with her work. "I am not going to say there is no pressure. I want to do it exactly the way my mother or brother (actor Abhimanyu Dassani) did it," Avantika added.

11.title: SP's Akhilesh Yadav wins his 1st Assembly election from Karhal
11.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief and former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav won his first Assembly election from Karhal constituency on Thursday by over 67,000 votes, EC's data shows. His closest rival was BJP's SP Singh Baghel. To note, Karhal has voted for SP since 1993, except in 2002 when BJP managed to win from there. SP has won 29 Assembly seats.

12.title: Kapil Sharma congratulates Bhagwant, says, 'You won heart of Punjab'
12.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Thursday congratulated Bhagwant Mann for AAP's victory in Punjab and wrote, "You not only won the elections but also the heart of Punjab." Sharma shared an image from his wedding featuring Mann on Instagram. "I pray to God that under your leadership Punjab will progress and achieve new heights," he wrote.

13.title: What was the biggest and lowest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly polls?
13.article_body: AAP's Aman Arora recorded biggest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly elections, winning Sunam constituency by a margin of 75,277 votes against Congress' Jaswinder Singh Dhiman. The lowest margin was recorded by AAP's Raman Arora, who won Jalandhar Central by 247 votes against Congress' Rajinder Beri. The second-lowest margin (466) was recorded by Congress' Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa.

14.title: 'Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta': Kejriwal on AAP's win
14.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday thanked voters of Punjab for delivering his party a win in the ongoing Assembly elections and said, "Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta." "Sukhbir Singh Badal lost, Captain Sahab lost, Channi Sahab lost, Parkash Singh Badal lost, Navjot Singh Sidhu lost, Bikram Singh Majithia lost. Punjab has done amazing," he further added.

15.title: People have put their stamp on Yogi ji's corruption free governance: Shah
15.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Thursday expressed his "heartfelt gratitude to the people of Uttar Pradesh," after trends showed BJP's victory in UP Assembly elections. Shah said, "People have put their stamp on UP CM Yogi Adityanath ji's fear and corruption-free good governance." Notably, BJP has won 103 seats and leading in 149 seats in UP.

16.title: We aren't politicians, BJP's win in UP is no loss for us: Tikait
16.article_body: As trends showed BJP's win in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Bharatiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait on Thursday said that BJP's victory in UP is not a loss of the BKU. Tikait said, "We are revolutionaries, activists. We are not politicians, so this is no win or loss for us." Notably, BJP has so far won 103 seats in UP.

17.title: Researchers suggest saffron was 1st domesticated in Bronze Age Greece
17.article_body: Researchers said artworks, genetics both pointed out that saffron or Crocus sativus, world's costliest spice, was first domesticated in Bronze Age Greece, around 1700 BC or earlier. Team revealed that artworks from ancient Greece's Minoan civilisation were likely the oldest to depict use of domesticated saffron. Scientists also found flowers with similar traits depicted on ceramics and cloth.

18.title: BBMP to float fresh tender to complete Ejipura flyover
18.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will float a fresh tender to complete the pending civil work for the construction of a flyover between Ejipura and Kendriya Sadan junction in Bengaluru's Koramangala. The development comes after the Karnataka government terminated the contract awarded to Simplex Infrastructures Limited. The firm had missed multiple project deadlines despite warnings.

19.title: Man stabs driver to death in Pune after suspecting affair with wife
19.article_body: A driver working at a bungalow in Maharashtra's Pune was allegedly stabbed to death by the caretaker of the same property. According to reports, the accused suspected the victim of having an illicit relationship with his wife and killed him after inviting him to an open plot for drinks. The accused was traced through technical intelligence and informants, police said.

20.title: Ukrainians defuse Russian bomb with bare hands & a water bottle, video viral
20.article_body: A video showing two specialists from Ukraine's State Emergency Service defusing an unexploded Russian bomb has gone viral online. In it, the two men are seen disarming the bomb with their bare hands and just a bottle of water. Middle East Institute programs director Charles Lister shared the clip saying the bomb was powerful enough to "flatten a building".

21.title: Russia bans sale of foreign currency cash to citizens for 6 months
21.article_body: Russia has banned foreign currency sales for six months until September 9, 2022, amid the falling value of the ruble against the US dollar. Banks and brokers are banned from selling US dollars, euros and other foreign currency in exchange for rubles. Additionally, Russians with existing foreign currency accounts are allowed to withdraw up to $10,000 in US dollars only.

22.title: 3 workers die after falling in septic tank in Mumbai's Kandivali
22.article_body: Three workers died due to suffocation on Thursday afternoon after they fell into a septic tank while cleaning it in Mumbai's Kandivali, police said. The incident took place after they entered a public toilet's septic tank in Ekta Nagar. Fire brigade and police officials rescued the workers, but all three were declared dead before being admitted to the hospital.

23.title: Pune's Nal Stop flyover to open for vehicular traffic from March 13
23.article_body: The double-storey flyover at Nal Stop on Pune’s Karve road will be operational from Sunday onwards, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has confirmed. “At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it’s important to have a flyover on this stretch,” Mohol added. The flyover was jointly executed by PMC and Maha Metro.

24.title: EU should show Ukraine 'open door' on membership, says Latvia's PM
24.article_body: Latvian Prime Minister Krisjanis Karins on Thursday said that the European Union needs to show Ukraine a "clear and open door" on EU membership. Earlier this month, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had signed an application for Ukraine to join the EU. Karins called for sanctions to be imposed on the Russian energy sector.

25.title: Cybercafe owner refuses to work despite payment, beats up doctor
25.article_body: A doctor in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, who went to a cybercafe for online passport applications, was beaten up by its owner on Wednesday. The victim said he was asked to pay ₹1,800 for each application but despite confirming the order, the owner continued others' work. He added he was thrashed after asking for his work to be done first.

26.title: Disney censors 'overtly gay affection' in Pixar films, claims letter by employees
26.article_body: Pixar employees penned a letter claiming Disney leaders censor same-sex love onscreen and cut "nearly every moment of overtly gay affection". Obtained by Variety, the letter is part of a wider reaction to memo sent to Disney employees by CEO Bob Chapek regarding response to Florida's 'Don't Say Gay' bill. Employees said they are being barred from creating LGBTQIA+ content.

27.title: UP CM & other BJP leaders play Holi at party office in Lucknow
27.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and other BJP leaders like Swatantra Dev Singh played Holi at the party's office in Lucknow after trends suggested BJP's win in UP. Adityanath was welcomed by cheering BJP workers at the office. As per the latest EC trends, BJP won 64 seats and took a lead on 187 seats.

28.title: I am thankful to the people: Yogi as trends suggest BJP's win in UP
28.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath today thanked the people of the state as trends suggested BJP's win in the UP Assembly elections. CM Yogi said, "Everyone had their eyes on UP, given...vastness of the state...I'm thankful to the people for making us win." Notably, Yogi won the Gorakhpur Urban seat by a margin of over 50,000 votes.

29.title: Hyd Police to provide pre-recruitment training (PRT) to youth
29.article_body: Hyderabad Police is to provide pre-recruitment training (PRT) to youth, both males and females, to help aspiring candidates secure a job in the force. Hyderabad Police Commissioner C V Anand's official Twitter handle announced that to motivate them HCP will provide all-around assistance by imparting PRT. It covers accommodation, classroom sessions, study material, physical training and mock tests.

30.title: BJP's Pankaj Singh, son of Rajnath Singh, wins Noida seat by 1.81 lakh votes
30.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's son, BJP's Pankaj Singh won the Noida seat in UP Assembly elections by a margin of 1,81,513 votes. Pankaj Singh received 2,44,319 votes, while SP's Sunil Choudhary received 62,806 votes, followed by BSP's Kripa Ram Sharma, who got 16,292 votes. In 2017 Assembly polls, Pankaj had won the Noida seat by a margin of 1,04,016.

31.title: What was the biggest and lowest margin of victory in Goa Assembly polls?
31.article_body: BJP's Deviya Vishwajit Rane recorded biggest margin of victory in Goa Assembly elections, winning Poriem constituency by a margin of 13,943 votes against AAP's Vishwajit K Rane. The lowest margin was recorded by Revolutionary Goans Party's Viresh Borkar, who won St Andre seat by 76 votes against BJP's Francisco Silveira. The second-lowest margin (77) was recorded by BJP's Ravi Naik.

32.title: Colgate-Palmolive India names Prabha Narasimhan as MD and CEO
32.article_body: Colgate-Palmolive (India) on Thursday announced it has appointed Prabha Narasimhan, former Executive Director of Hindustan Unilever, as its new CEO and Managing Director (MD). Ram Raghavan, the MD and CEO of Colgate-Palmolive (India), has been promoted to President of enterprise oral care for Colgate-Palmolive. Raghavan will be based out of Colgate-Palmolive headquarters at New York, it added.

33.title: Court rejects Kangana's plea to transfer defamation case by Javed
33.article_body: A Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday rejected actress Kangana Ranaut's plea seeking transfer of the defamation case filed against her by lyricist Javed Akhtar from the magistrate's court in Andheri. The court also refused to transfer her counter-complaint against Javed filed in Andheri court elsewhere. Kangana had claimed that the magistrate's court showed "bias and prejudice towards her".

34.title: Putin wouldn't refuse meeting with Ukraine's Prez: Foreign Minister
34.article_body: Russia's President Vladimir Putin would not refuse a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy to discuss "specific" issues, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Thursday. Notably, Lavrov made the comment after his meeting with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba. Russian and Ukrainian officials held three rounds of talks before the talks between Lavrov and Kuleba.

35.title: Political front of farmers' unions fails to win single seat in Punjab
35.article_body: The Sanyukt Samaj Morcha (SSM), a political front of 22 farmers' unions, failed to win a single seat in Punjab polls despite fielding candidates in all 117 seats. The unions had protested against the now-repealed three farm laws. An SSM official blamed fragile unity among farmers and power struggle for the result. AAP is set to form government in Punjab.

36.title: Marriott pauses new hotel openings, investment in Russia
36.article_body: Hotel chain Marriott on Thursday said it has paused opening of new hotels and all future hotel development and investment in Russia owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Marriott will also close its corporate office in Russia. "Our hotels in Russia are owned by third parties and we continue to evaluate the ability for [them] to remain open," the company said.

37.title: Srikanth wins, Sindhu loses in 2nd round at German Open
37.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu was defeated in the second round of women's singles at the 2022 German Open on Thursday. The seventh seed lost to unseeded Zhang Yi Man of China 14-21, 21-15, 14-21 in 55 minutes at Westenergie Sporthalle. Earlier, India's Kidambi Srikanth beat China's Lu Guang Zu 21-16, 21-23, 21-18 to enter the men's singles quarter-finals.

38.title: Mumbai police seize fake diabetes test strips worth ₹5 lakh, one held
38.article_body: The Crime Branch control unit of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Mumbai Police has arrested a man for selling fake diabetes test strips and seized around 669 boxes worth ₹5.02 lakhs. The accused was caught "red-handed with possession of the counterfeit diabetics checking strips 'One Touch' product of Lifescan Scotland limited," a police officer said.

39.title: B'luru men threaten loan borrowers to post morphed pics online; held
39.article_body: Police have arrested two men, who ran a call centre in Bengaluru and offered loans through apps, for allegedly harassing people over loan repayments. The accused threatened people to post their morphed pictures on social media if they didn't repay the loan, the police said. They were operating the loan apps under the supervision of a Chinese national.

40.title: Which CMs and former CMs have lost their seats in the assembly elections?
40.article_body: As counting of votes for five state assembly elections is underway, Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi lost from two seats and Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami lost from his Khatima seat. Meanwhile, former Uttarakhand CM Harish Singh Rawat and former Goa CM Churchill Alemao also lost from their seats. Former Punjab CMs Parkash Singh Badal and Amarinder Singh also lost.

41.title: BJP spreading rumours by celebrating, we'll form govt in UP: SP leader
41.article_body: Amid counting of votes in UP Assembly polls, Samajwadi Party (SP) state president Naresh Uttam Patel said BJP is "spreading rumours" by celebrating, adding that SP will form government in UP. "SP workers shouldn't be disheartened and remain...at counting centres," he added. The BJP has won 50 seats in UP and is leading in 200 seats, according to latest trends.

42.title: Sweden vows to raise military spending amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
42.article_body: The Swedish government on Thursday said that it'll raise Sweden's defence spending to 2% of the country's GDP. The security situation in Europe has deteriorated amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, it added. However, Defence Minister Peter Hultqvist said it was too early to say how long it would take to get to 2% and that it depended on several factors.

43.title: Ukraine to create state food reserve for people, armed forces: Govt
43.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Wednesday said government will create a food reserve big enough to feed people and armed forces amid war with Russia, reported government press service. "The state will redeem grain and other stocks in the volumes of annual consumption...," Shmyhal added. Meanwhile, agriculture analysts said Russian invasion could create food shortages for Ukraine and the world.

44.title: Pakistan logs 639 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
44.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Thursday said the country reported 639 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 4 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to over 30,000. NCOC added that out of 18,049 active cases, 707 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 1.76% from 2.07%.

45.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath wins Gorakhpur Urban in his 1st Assembly election
45.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath on Thursday won the Gorakhpur Urban seat by a margin of over 50,000 votes in his first Assembly election. Adityanath won against Samajwadi Party candidate Subhawati Upendra Dutt Shukla, who got the second-highest votes polled. BJP looks set to retain UP with trends suggesting it'll win around 250 seats.

46.title: My father Feroz Khan introduced pop music to Hindi cinema: Fardeen
46.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has stated that his father late veteran actor Feroz Khan was the first to introduce pop music to Hindi cinema with his films 'Dharmatma' and 'Qurbani'. "Music is one aspect where he excelled. 'Qurbani' was his first four-track stereo recording which was done in London at the time for that one song 'Aap Jaisa Koi'," Fardeen said.

47.title: Double engine government always standing for people: Scindia
47.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, speaking about the election results, said people have given a historic victory to BJP. He added that under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, it's clear that double engine government is always standing for people, their trust and progress. Scindia added that students were brought back from war-struck Ukraine even in the election environment.

48.title: Kim says 'get your f***ing a** up and work' to women in business; criticised
48.article_body: Businesswoman and socialite Kim Kardashian is being criticised for her remarks in a Variety Magazine interview, where she said, "I have the best advice for the women in business, get your f***ing a** up and work." She added, "It seems like nobody wants to work these days." Several people criticised her, with one tweeting, "Also: be born rich. Really helps."

49.title: Ed Sheeran sings in court to prove he hasn't copied parts of 'Shape of You'
49.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran sang in London's High Court during a copyright case trial related to his 2017 song 'Shape of You'. He's accused of copying the "Oh I, oh I, oh I" part from Sami Chokri's 2015 single 'Oh Why'. He sang elements of Nina Simone's 'Feeling Good' and Blackstreet's 'No Diggity' to show how the melodies can sound similar.

50.title: He lied, betrayed fans: Kaneria on PCB Chairman Raja over Rawalpindi pitch
50.article_body: Criticising Ramiz Raja for defending Rawalpindi pitch used for drawn Pakistan-Australia first Test, ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman "has lied and betrayed the fans". Earlier, Raja issued a statement saying although the pitch wasn't a good advertisement for Test cricket, they didn't want to create a pitch that put the match in Australia's lap.

51.title: Chandrayaan-2 spectrometer discovers Argon in Moon's exosphere: ISRO
51.article_body: ISRO on Tuesday said that Chandra's Atmospheric Composition Explorer-2, a mass spectrometer onboard Chandrayaan-2 mission has made the first-of-its-kind observations of global distribution of Argon-40 in the tenuous lunar exosphere. "These observations provide insight on the dynamics of the lunar exospheric species..." ISRO added. Earlier, the gas was found only near Moon's equatorial region.

52.title: U'khand poll results are very surprising for me: Cong's Harish Rawat
52.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM and Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said Uttarakhand's Assembly election results are "very surprising" for him. "I cannot understand that after such massive inflation, if this was the public's mandate, what is the definition of public welfare and social justice?" Rawat said. Can't understand people saying "BJP zindabad" after this, he added.

53.title: No progress on ceasefire: Ukraine Foreign Min after meeting Russia's Lavrov
53.article_body: Ukraine and Russia made "no progress" towards agreeing on a 24-hour ceasefire after talks in Turkey, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said on Thursday. Kuleba described the meeting with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov as "difficult" and accused him of bringing "traditional narratives" about Ukraine to the table. Kuleba added that "Ukraine hasn't surrendered...and will not surrender".

54.title: Punjab BJP chief Ashwani Sharma wins from Pathankot seat
54.article_body: Punjab BJP chief Ashwani Sharma won from the Pathankot assembly seat on Thursday, defeating Congress candidate and sitting MLA Amit Vij by a margin of 7,759 votes. The Aam Aadmi Party is set to form the government in Punjab after crossing the majority mark. However, BJP is set to retain power in Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh.

55.title: As long as he is fit, nobody can touch him: Gaekwad on Kohli
55.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's 100th Test, ex-India head coach Anshuman Gaekwad said he won't be surprised to see the ex-captain playing 200 Tests, a feat achieved by only Sachin Tendulkar, due to his current fitness. "As long as he [Kohli] is fit, nobody can touch him...he'll...play for the next 10 years," he added. Kohli has scored 8,007 Test runs so far.

56.title: Hyd Police issues lookout notice for man missing for over 2 months
56.article_body: Hyderabad Police has issued a lookout notice for a 44-year-old man who has been missing since December 21, 2021. The notice was shared on the official Twitter handle of SHO Madannapet, D Santosh Kumar, with the man's picture and details. The man, named as Pogula Ravinder Raju in an FIR, had allegedly vanished after being released from jail on bail.

57.title: Deliveroo opens engineering centre in Hyd; its largest tech hub outside UK
57.article_body: Deliveroo, a United Kingdom-based food delivery company, has announced the launch of its India Engineering Centre in Hyderabad. The engineering centre will be Deliveroo's largest technology hub outside the UK, the company's press release stated. The company has also started hiring and it plans to employ more than 150 engineers in India by the end of 2022, the release added.

58.title: Before and after pics show destruction in Ukrainian city
58.article_body: Maxar has released before and after satellite images showing destruction of Ukrainian city Mariupol. Extensive damage is seen to civilian infrastructure, including residential homes, high-rise apartment buildings, supermarkets and shopping centres. The city's deputy mayor, Sergei Orlov, told reporters of several civilian targets hit so far, including a children's and maternity hospital.

59.title: People voted for security, infra: BJP's Rita Bahuguna on UP results
59.article_body: Reacting to BJP's performance in the Uttar Pradesh elections, party MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi on Thursday said the people voted on the issues of security and infrastructure. "Public mood is set for development, this is the win of 'Modi-Yogi' double engine government," she said. "After 30 years, a same party is forming government for the second time," she added.

60.title: PM fulfilled promises made to people: BJP leader on U'khand results
60.article_body: Senior BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Thursday said that the party's performance in Uttarakhand was anticipated, adding that PM Narendra Modi fulfilled the promises he made to the people. He further said that Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami "resolved the issues of the people in the last six months". The latest trends suggest BJP is leading with 47 seats.

61.title: 3 policemen jailed in Gurugram for wrongly framing cybercafe owner
61.article_body: A Gurugram court on Wednesday sentenced a retired police sub-inspector to five years imprisonment and three constables to three years in jail for framing and illegally confining a cybercafe owner in 2009. The accused had raided Hansraj Rathi's premises, accusing him of making fake voter ID cards and booked a false case against him for refusing to pay a bribe.

62.title: I am always criticised no matter if I am in the team or not: Imam
62.article_body: Reacting to criticism received despite being named Player of the Match in the first Test between Pakistan and Australia, batter Imam-ul-Haq said, "I am always criticised...if I am in the team or not." "The management [will] decide whether my runs...are quality or not," added Imam. Imam scored 157, 111* respectively in both innings of the first Test.

63.title: Govt school peon suspended for watching obscene videos at work in MP
63.article_body: A peon working at a government girls' school has been suspended for allegedly watching obscene videos at work and for neglecting his duties in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, an official said on Wednesday. "His suspension orders were issued under the Civil Services Conduct Rules," District Education Officer (DEO) Manglesh Vyas said.

64.title: Anganwadi workers in Delhi temporarily suspend strike
64.article_body: Anganwadi workers in Delhi have temporarily suspended their strike after the Lieutenant Governor imposed the Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA) for six months, Delhi State Anganwadi Workers and Helpers Union (DSAWHU) President Shivani said. DSAWHU has been on strike since January 1. They have demanded an increase in honorarium, respectable working hours and status as government employees.

65.title: Ex-UP minister Swami Prasad Maurya, who joined SP, loses by 32,000 votes
65.article_body: A former minister in Uttar Pradesh cabinet Swami Prasad Maurya, who had joined Akhilesh Yadav's Samajwadi Party just ahead of state polls, lost from Fazilnagar seat by over 32,000 votes, EC data shows. He was defeated by Surendra Kumar Kushwaha of BJP. Notably, this time Maurya chose to not contest from Padrauna, from where he was elected since 2007.

66.title: Surrey sign Sunil Narine for English domestic T20 season
66.article_body: The Surrey County Cricket Club has signed West Indies spinner Sunil Narine for this year's domestic T20 tournament, Vitality Blast, on Wednesday. The Trinidadian is the first overseas player to be signed by the county club for their T20 squad for this year. Narine is likely to join the county club after the completion of his IPL commitments.

67.title: As a batter, you can roll out same Rawalpindi pitch for 2nd Test: Warner
67.article_body: Responding to a query about the pitch expected for the second Test between Pakistan, Australia, David Warner joked he is happy to see the same Rawalpindi pitch used for the first Test as a batter. Both teams aggregated 1,187 runs with Warner scoring 68 runs in the first innings. "I...want a game where you can create 20 chances," added Warner.

68.title: BJP reaches halfway mark in Goa, emerges as single largest party in state
68.article_body: BJP has reached the halfway mark of 20 in Goa, emerging as the single largest party in the state Assembly election. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said that three independent candidates have extended their support to BJP. A party or an alliance needs at least 21 seats to form the government in Goa.

69.title: Who is Jeevan Jyot, AAP candidate who defeated Navjot Sidhu in Amritsar East?
69.article_body: AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur, who defeated Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal's Bikram Majithia from Amritsar East seat, is AAP's district president for Amritsar (Urban). She's known as Punjab's 'pad woman' for creating awareness among underprivileged women about ill-effects of plastic sanitary pads. She reportedly tied up with a Swiss-based company to provide women with reusable pads.

70.title: I'm working in best era of cinema, there's acceptance: Vaani
70.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has stated that she feels she is working in the best era of Hindi cinema. The actress added that there is a wide acceptance of subjects that were deemed forbidden for actors to choose. "The fact that the industry has produced...back-to-back progressive films...shows the paradigm shift that the Hindi film industry is going through," Vaani said.

71.title: Bulldozer is a symbol of uprooting mafias: Anurag on UP results
71.article_body: As BJP heads towards a victory in Uttar Pradesh and other state elections, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said bulldozer has become a symbol of uprooting mafias and criminals. He said the victory in these states wouldn't have been possible without the hard work of party workers. "We'll further implement PM [Narendra] Modi's welfare policies in UP," he added.

72.title: NTPC Vindhyachal to set up carbon capture plant in MP to tackle pollution
72.article_body: The NTPC Vindhyachal power plant in Madhya Pradesh will set up a carbon capture plant to tackle pollution, an official said. As a pilot project, the facility will be set up in Vindhyachal, wherein hydrogen will be mixed with carbon dioxide released from the plant. The methanol which will release as a by-product can be further used, the official added.

73.title: 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum' remake starring John, Arjun Kapoor put on hold
73.article_body: The Hindi remake of Biju Menon and Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum' starring John Abraham and Arjun Kapoor has been put on hold due to date issues. Filmmaker Jagan Shakti had announced the film in 2021, saying that John will take on the role that was played by Biju in the original film, while Arjun will portray Prithviraj's character Koshi Kurian.

74.title: Ukraine's membership in EU 'will take time': France minister
74.article_body: Ukraine's membership in European Union (EU) "will take time", French European Affairs Minister Clement Beaune said, as EU leaders arrived in France to discuss crisis following Russian invasion of Ukraine. Beaune's comment came even as eight EU countries had sought expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application to join EU last month.

75.title: AAP MLAs reach Kumar Vishwas' home to offer sweets amid poll results
75.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLAs on Thursday went to the residence of poet Kumar Vishwas to offer him sweets after early trends showed the party crossing the majority mark in Punjab. However, the delegation led by MLA Manoj Kumar was reportedly stopped outside Kumar's residence by security personnel. According to ECI, AAP has won 64 seats in Punjab till now.

76.title: SC closes nearly 70 criminal cases against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji
76.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed nearly 70 criminal cases filed by India Awake for Transparency, an NGO, against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji and his wife Yasmeen Azim Premji. It filed the cases for breach of trust and corruption during a merger with a firm from the Azim Premji group. The NGO later issued an unconditional apology in the SC.

77.title: Bulldozer of development will continue to work in UP: Piyush Goyal
77.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said that the "bulldozer" of development will continue to work in Uttar Pradesh. "It shows the popularity of PM Modi across the country. It's the result of PM Modi and CM Yogi's social welfare schemes which were implemented honestly," Goyal added. "We are getting more seats in Goa and Manipur than before," Goyal stated.

78.title: Belarus Prez orders specialists to restore Chernobyl power supply
78.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has instructed specialists to ensure that power is supplied to Chernobyl nuclear power plant in Ukraine, state news agency Belta reported. This comes after Ukraine warned that there was a danger of a radiation leak at the plant amid power cut. Chernobyl, which was taken over by Russian forces, is situated near Ukraine's border with Belarus.

79.title: Our campaign strategy was insufficient, I accept our defeat in U'khand: Harish Rawat
79.article_body: After trends showed that BJP is winning majority of seats in Uttarakhand Assembly elections, Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said, "I accept it & take responsibility for the defeat." He added, "Our campaign strategy was insufficient and I accept it as chairman of Campaign Committee." He further said that results were surprising for him.

80.title: Will learn from this: Rahul as trends show Cong's defeat in 5 states
80.article_body: After trends suggested that Congress is losing all five state elections, former party chief Rahul Gandhi on Thursday tweeted, "We will learn from this and keep working for the interests of the people of India." "Humbly accept the people's verdict. Best wishes to those who have won the mandate," he wrote. He also expressed gratitude towards Congress workers and volunteers.

81.title: Stayed at his house to understand him: Boman on playing Farokh Engineer in 83
81.article_body: Actor Boman Irani recalled how he prepared for the role of legendary Indian commentator Farokh Engineer in '83'. He said, "I got a chance to meet Farokh and stay over at his place. We watched the India-Pakistan match together." "That was one of the best times...While staying with him, the idea was to...understand the man, his psyche," he added.

82.title: Had a great time shooting with Katrina; she excels at everything: Dhairya
82.article_body: Speaking about his experience of working with Katrina Kaif in a new soft drink commercial, Dhairya Karwa who starred in 'Gehraiyaan', said he had a great time shooting with her. "She's humble and really sweet," he added. "Inspiring to see someone so driven and hardworking even after all the years of success. She excels at everything she does," he added.

83.title: No truth to it: Shamita on rumours of break up with Raqesh Bapat
83.article_body: Shamita Shetty took to her Instagram Stories and refuted a report claiming that she and actor Raqesh Bapat have decided to separate as "they were clashing on too many things". "We request [you] not to believe in any sort of rumours pertaining to our relationship. There's no truth in this. Love and light to everyone," Shamita wrote.

84.title: Cong on way to becoming regional party: Ex-Union Minister Ashwani Kumar
84.article_body: Former Union Minister Ashwani Kumar, while reacting to the Assembly election result trends in five states, said the relevance of Congress party in future will remain 'negligible'. "In view of political scenarios emerging out in the country, the Congress party will remain a regional party," said Kumar who had quit the party last month.

85.title: YouTube, Google Play store suspend payment-based services in Russia
85.article_body: YouTube and Google Play store are suspending all payment-based services in Russia, including subscriptions, amid growing sanctions on the country. Earlier, Google and YouTube had halted selling online advertising in Russia. "As a follow-up, we're now extending this pause to all our monetization features, including YouTube Premium...for viewers in Russia," YouTube said.

86.title: Done a lot of work on playing spin: NZ's Amelia Kerr after victory
86.article_body: New Zealand Women batter Amelia Kerr praised her team's batting efforts which helped them in registering a win over India by 62 runs at the Women's World Cup match on Thursday. "I have done a lot of work on playing spin this winter, at the moment it seems to be going well,” Kerr said.

87.title: India's first indoor skydiving facility to be launched in Hyderabad
87.article_body: India's first indoor skydiving facility will be launched in Hyderabad in April. The facility, offered by GravityZip, will have certified trainers from Europe and the entire skydiving experience will be 90-minutes, including training, according to a news report. Flyers must be aged more than three years to experience the indoor skydiving, which will be provided inside a vertical cylindrical tunnel.

88.title: Brown sugar worth over ₹1.32 crore seized in Odisha; 3 arrested
88.article_body: Three persons were arrested after the Special Task Force (STF) seized 1.32 kg of brown sugar worth over ₹1.32 crore from their possession in Odisha's Khordha district, police said on Thursday. They also seized ₹1.65 lakh cash and a motorcycle from them. A case under relevant sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985 has been registered.

89.title: No construction activity in Mumbai between 10 pm-6 am: Police chief
89.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Wednesday said construction activities in Mumbai will only be allowed between 6 am and 10 pm to keep the city's noise pollution under control. He said noise levels at the sites must remain under 65 decibels. Display boards indicating timings and decibel levels must be installed at all sites, he added.

90.title: Manipur CM N Biren Singh wins from his home constituency of Heingang
90.article_body: Manipur Chief Minister and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Nongthombam Biren Singh has won from his home constituency Heingang in the state's East Imphal district. Singh got 78.54% of the total votes polled and defeated Pangeijam Saratchandra Singh of Congress by 18,271 votes. The BJP has so far won 14 seats in Manipur and is leading on 13 others.

91.title: Tamil actress forced to strip at knifepoint in Chennai, 2 men record act on phone camera
91.article_body: Police have arrested two men for barging into the house of a 35-year-old Tamil actress, forcing her to strip at knife-point and recording the act on phone camera in Chennai. After filming the act, the accused escaped with 10 grams of gold jewellery worth ₹55,000. Police identified the accused as Kannadasan and Selvakumar with the help of CCTV footage.

92.title: It was a complete performance vs India, hope we can carry it forward: Devine
92.article_body: New Zealand Women captain Sophie Devine has said that their performance against India in their ODI World Cup match was "complete" and they want to carry it forward to the next game. "We built partnerships throughout...The bowling was outstanding, just didn't give them anything at all," she stated. It was New Zealand's second win from three games in the tournament.

93.title: 5-day Tripura budget session to begin from March 17
93.article_body: The five-day budget session of Tripura assembly will begin on March 17, state Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ratan Lal Nath said on Thursday. Around five to seven bills, including Tripura National University Bill, 2022, will be tabled during the session, he added. Notably, this will be the last budget of the BJP-IPFT government before the state assembly elections next year.

94.title: UK freezes Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich's assets, blocking the club's sale
94.article_body: The UK has imposed sanctions on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, which includes freezing of assets and a prohibition on transactions with UK individuals. This means that he cannot sell Chelsea or invest in the football club. Abramovich is among seven Russians targeted in fresh sanctions. The list includes Rosneft CEO Igor Sechin, an ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

95.title: Not opposed to Pete, Kanye appearing on 'The Kardashians': Kim
95.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian has said that she is not opposed to her boyfriend Pete Davidson appearing on her reality show 'The Kardashians'. She added that it's just not what he does but Pete won't tell the cameras to get away. Kim further said that her co-parenting journey with ex-husband Kanye West will be really beautiful for people to see.

96.title: People of Punjab defeated BJP, Congress & gave mandate to AAP: Sharad Pawar
96.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday said that the people of Punjab have defeated the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Congress and gave a mandate to the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) "There was anger against PM Modi in the hearts of Punjab farmers...BJP will have to wait for 2.5 years in Maharashtra," Pawar added.

97.title: Serious mental illness may increase risk of heart disease in adults: Study
97.article_body: A US-based study that analysed over 6,00,000 adults revealed that people who are diagnosed with serious mental illness like bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder may be at higher risk of developing cardiovascular diseases at young age. The study found that such people die 10-20 years earlier than the general population with the leading cause of death being heart diseases.

98.title: Hyderabad to host 'Wings India' event after 2-yr delay due to COVID
98.article_body: Hyderabad is set to host the biennial 'Wings India 2022' event, deemed as Asia's largest Civil Aviation show, after two years of delay due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The flagship event was reduced to a business event in March 2020 after the virus scare. Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia is said to have confirmed his participation in the event.

99.title: Financial services firm EbixCash to raise ₹6,000 crore through IPO
99.article_body: EbixCash, the Indian subsidiary of Nasdaq-listed Ebix Inc, has filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO to raise ₹6,000 crore through a fresh issue of shares. The firm may consider a pre-IPO placement of as much as ₹1,200 crore, the DRHP said. EbixCash has a network of over 6,50,000 physical agent distribution outlets for payment solutions.

100.title: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami loses from Khatima seat
100.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has lost to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri from the Khatima assembly seat in the state election. This comes as BJP is leading in 45 assemblies in the state and has gained victory in three. Meanwhile, Congress is leading in 16 assemblies and has won two seats so far.

101.title: Our economy is experiencing a shock: Russia
101.article_body: As the West imposed sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, the country said, "Our economy is experiencing a shock impact now and there are negative consequences, they will be minimised." "This is absolutely unprecedented. The economic war that has started against us has never taken place before. So it is very hard to forecast anything," it added.

102.title: Our national leaders will decide on CM face: Manipur CM N Biren Singh
102.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Thursday said BJP's national leaders will decide on the CM face. "We'll take time to stake a claim to form the government, let the results be out...We'll focus on PM Modi's mantra of inclusive development," Singh added. The BJP won 13 seats and is leading on 13 other seats in the 60-seat Manipur Assembly.

103.title: Gaurakshak Dal member issues threat to UP Cong, RLD leader
103.article_body: A member of the Gaurakshak Dal, a cow vigilante group, released a video in which he allegedly threatened former four-time Congress MLA Pradeep Mathur and RLD's state Vice President Kunwar Narendra Singh. The video was made in connection to the Manoharpura (Mathura) incident where the cow vigilante group alleged that beef was stored at a local resident's house, police said.

104.title: 3 independent candidates are supporting BJP: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
104.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said that three independent candidates have extended their support to BJP. Reportedly, these candidates are Dr Chandrakant Shetye, Antonio Vas and Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco who won from Bicholim, Cortalim and Curtorim constituencies respectively. Sawant added, "I have won with low margins but we [BJP] have won with a majority...20 seats [are] confirmed."

105.title: Why wait years to file complaint?: Shailaja to alleged rape victims of tattoo artist
105.article_body: Commenting on alleged rape cases against a tattoo artist in Kerala's Kochi, state's former Health Minister KK Shailaja said, "Why are you (survivors) waiting years to file a complaint?" She added, "You should report it immediately." At least six women filed sexual assault complaints against the tattoo artist after an 18-year-old girl alleged she was raped in a tattoo studio.

106.title: No two countries run by women would ever go to war: Meta COO on Russia-Ukraine
106.article_body: Sheryl Sandberg, the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Facebook's parent company Meta, spoke about the Russia-Ukraine war, and said, "No two countries run by women would go to war, ever." She said, "There are 12 countries in this world that are run by women." She added, "Those countries run by women, in the early days of COVID-19, did better."

107.title: Putin took us down as social media is bad for dictators: Meta COO
107.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta's COO Sheryl Sandberg in an interview discussing Russia's decision to block Facebook said, "Social media is bad for dictators. That's why Putin took us down." "The scariest part...is the lack of access. When we go down in Russia people are losing their ability to actually understand what's happening...We need to fight for access," she added.

108.title: No-fly zone over Ukraine would end war faster: Polish envoy
108.article_body: Poland's Ambassador to Ukraine, Bartosz Cichocki, said imposing no-fly zone over Ukraine would save more lives and end war faster. Cichocki's comment comes amid requests by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to NATO to impose no-fly zone, which latter has refused. Notably, Poland's PM has said that any supply of fighter jets to Ukraine must be done jointly by NATO countries.

109.title: Mithali Raj starts a geometry class when she goes out to bat: Veda
109.article_body: Terming Mithali Raj as the "best" non-striker, India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy shared a joke in the dressing room that Mithali starts a "geometry class" for the opposition when she goes out to bat. "Mithali's cover drives are textbook, she pierces the field no matter how many fielders you place," added Veda. "Mithali should come at number three," stated Veda.

110.title: Sensex ends 817 points higher at 55,464 amid Assembly election results
110.article_body: The Sensex ended 817 points higher at 55,464.39 on Thursday amid five state assembly election results. Benchmark indices ended higher for the third consecutive session, with the broader Nifty surging 249 points or 1.53% to settle at 16,594.90. HUL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SBI were among top Nifty gainers, whereas Coal India, Tech Mahindra, TCS were the biggest losers.

111.title: Sonu Sood's sister & Congress' Malvika Sood loses from Punjab's Moga
111.article_body: Congress candidate from Punjab's Moga Malvika Sood, who is also the sister of Bollywood actor Sonu Sood, lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Dr Amandeep Kaur Arora on Thursday. Arora won by over 20,000 votes. Trends have been showing an AAP victory in Punjab and the party CM's face Bhagwant Mann earlier said his biggest priority is creating jobs.

112.title: Tiger shares video from when he was 'fat', learnt his 'first-ever skill'
112.article_body: Tiger Shroff took to Instagram and recalled the time when he learnt his "first-ever skill". He shared a video wherein he can be seen performing a wall flip on a beach. "Found an old video of me learning my first-ever skill...Gosh, that sand was impossible to run on back when the struggle was real...especially with my fat ass," Tiger wrote.

113.title: We'll change India's politics: Kejriwal as AAP set to form govt in Punjab
113.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal called Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann his "younger brother" and congratulated him for poll win. As AAP looked set to form government in Punjab, Kejriwal said, "People have put a lot of faith in us, we won't break it. We will change this country's politics." The party crossed halfway mark of 59 seats in Punjab.

114.title: BJP leading in 7 out of 8 Lakhimpur Kheri seats in UP Assembly polls
114.article_body: The BJP is leading in seven out of eight seats in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri in the Assembly elections. The Samajwadi Party is leading in Mohammdi constituency. Notably, eight people, including four farmers, were killed during violence that erupted in the district on October 3, 2021. Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra is an accused in the case.

115.title: Russia confirms using vacuum bombs that can 'rupture lungs' in Ukraine, says UK
115.article_body:
Russia has confirmed it has used "vacuum bombs" in Ukraine, according to the UK's Ministry of Defence.
The UK MoD said its Russian counterpart said the TOS-1A weapon system had been deployed. The system uses thermobaric rockets, creating incendiary and blast effects, the MoD added. These bombs suck in the air around targets and can rupture their lungs.

116.title: Working early helps you grow faster: Ananya on starting her career at 19
116.article_body: Speaking about starting her career at 19, actress Ananya Panday said that during her initial days, she felt disconnected from her friends as they all were in college and she was on the sets working. "No textbook in this world...can educate enough like your workplace," she added. Ananya also believes that working early does help you to grow up faster.

117.title: Over 12,000 Russian soldiers killed, 335 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
117.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that over 12,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The ministry added that its military has destroyed 335 Russian tanks and over 125 aircraft, including 81 helicopters. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1,105 armoured vehicles,123 artillery systems, 526 vehicles and seven unmanned aerial vehicles.

118.title: Nothing can come in front of bulldozer, it can finish everything: Hema Malini
118.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Thursday said that nothing can come in front of a "bulldozer" as it can finish everything within a minute, be it a cycle or anything else. "We already knew our government will be formed, we have worked for every developmental aspect which is why the public trust us," Malini added.

119.title: Batting needs to get better: Mithali on India's 62-run loss to NZ in WC
119.article_body: After their 62-run defeat against New Zealand in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women captain Mithali Raj said their batting needs to get better in the upcoming matches. "It was a [gettable] score, provided the top order managed the run rate properly," she stated. New Zealand posted 260/9 and restricted India to 198/10.

120.title: Sea creatures learned to gallop even before land animals existed: Study
120.article_body: A study has found that fish-like animals pioneered the ability to gallop 472 million years ago, even before the complex form of life emerged onto land. According to the analysis, ancestral sea creatures were capable of moving with some kind of proto-asymmetric gait. But researchers believe many of the modern-day animals may have lost this ability during evolution.

121.title: Work on Bengaluru rail corridor-2 to begin by March 31: Minister
121.article_body: Karnataka's Infrastructure Development and Housing Minister V Somanna has informed the Legislative Council that the state government will expedite work on the Bengaluru suburban rail project. "We have floated tenders...By March 31 we will be issuing a work order for corridor-2," he said. The project aims to link Bengaluru with its satellite townships, suburbs and surrounding rural areas.

122.title: Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to touch 37°C by March 15
122.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Wednesday predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 37°C by March 15, adding that the city will witness mainly clear skies. On Tuesday, Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 31°C for the first time in 2022. Meanwhile, Gurugram's air quality improved to the "moderate" category on Wednesday, with an AQI reading of 162.

123.title: AAP to form govt in Punjab as party marks its 1st win outside Delhi
123.article_body: AAP has crossed the majority mark of 59 seats in Punjab Assembly election, marking its victory in the state by a big margin. This is the party's first win outside Delhi, with comedian-turned-politician Bhagwant Mann as its CM face. Meanwhile, Congress has won nine seats, SAD one seat and BJP two seats so far.

124.title: BJP leads in Hathras, Congress yet to cross 1,000 votes
124.article_body: BJP was leading in UP's Hathras Assembly seat at the end of the 14th round of counting of votes. The party's candidate Anjula Singh Mahaur bagged over 59,000 votes, well ahead of the rival parties SP (over 16,000 votes), BSP (over 22,000 votes) and Congress. Congress' Kuldeep Kumar Singh was yet to cross the 1,000-vote mark.

125.title: People of Punjab have shown Kejriwal isn't a terrorist: Delhi CM
125.article_body: As early trends showed AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab, party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that with these results, people have shown that "Kejriwal is not a terrorist but a real 'Desh Bhakt'". AAP has won 59 seats in Punjab till now, according to ECI. "The results are a massive revolution," he added.

126.title: Tesla hikes China, US prices for Model 3 and Model Y cars
126.article_body: Tesla has hiked the prices of its US Model Y SUVs and Model 3 Long Range sedans by $1,000 each. It has also increased the prices of some China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles by $1,582.40, its website revealed. Tesla's Model Y Long Range car's price has reportedly jumped 20% from January 2021.

127.title: Body of missing soldier on leave found in J&K's Budgam after 3 days
127.article_body: The body of a soldier, who had come home on leave and went missing from his village three days ago, has been recovered from Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam on Thursday. Sameer Malla was on leave as his wife had given birth to their second child. Malla had left home to visit a neighbour but didn't return, a family member claimed.

128.title: Will win 20 seats or even 1-2 seats more in Goa: BJP's Devendra Fadnavis
128.article_body: As counting for the 2022 Goa Assembly elections is underway, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that BJP will win 20 seats or even one-two seats more. "People have shown faith in PM Narendra Modi. Independent candidates are coming with us. Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) is also coming with us and taking all together, we will form our government," Fadnavis added.

129.title: No basis to such reports: Akshay on rift with Arshad post Jolly LLB 2
129.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar reacted to the reports of an alleged rift with his 'Bachchhan Paandey' co-star Arshad Warsi, during the release of their film Jolly LL.B 2. Putting the rumours to rest, Akshay said nothing of that sort happened between him and Arshad. He said, "There's no basis to such reports. I...maintain cordial relations with whoever I collaborate with professionally."

130.title: AAP asked Punjab to use 'jhadu' but they took vacuum cleaner: Chadha
130.article_body: As trends show Aam Aadmi Party's victory in Punjab, the party's leader Raghav Chadha said the people of the state had given a decisive mandate. He said the AAP had appealed to the people to use 'jhadu' (broom) in Punjab but they decided to switch on the vacuum cleaner. Punjab proved it likes the Arvind Kejriwal-Bhagwant Mann pair, he added.

131.title: Ashneer's wife criticised staff for amount of coffee, printouts at work: Report
131.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover, sacked as BharatPe's Head of Controls over alleged financial irregularities, "threatened a colleague with salary deduction for making printouts at work", Bloomberg reported citing current and former employees. She "criticised people for the amount of coffee consumed". She also questioned the price of a TV or bike intended as gifts for merchant promotion.

132.title: Salman to start shooting for Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather' from March 12: Reports
132.article_body: Salman Khan will start shooting for his cameo in Chiranjeevi's upcoming film 'Godfather' from March 12 at ND Studios in Karjat, reported Pinkvilla. "It's going to be a weeklong schedule with the two superstars as they will be shooting some action and dramatic scenes in the set-up," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Godfather' also stars Nayanthara.

133.title: Have soft spot for Munawar, it's never going to be two-way: Saisha
133.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who is a contestant on reality television show 'Lock Upp', revealed to co-contestant Sara Khan during one of the tasks that she has a soft spot for comedian Munawar Faruqui. "I am just feeling for him...I know that is only going to be one way, it's never going to be two-way," she said.

134.title: Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten: Butt on Rawalpindi Test
134.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has criticised the PCB over the pitch used in the Rawalpindi Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Pindi is a result-oriented pitch. In first-class matches, people complain that matches end here in 2.5 days...Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten," Butt stated. "It's their weakness in underestimating themselves," he added.

135.title: Unfortunate that Maha CM, Guv don’t trust each other: Bombay HC
135.article_body: The Bombay High Court  said that it was "unfortunate" that CM Uddhav Thackeray and Governor BS Koshyari "did not trust each other". It would be appropriate for the two to sit together and sort out the differences, the bench added. The court made the observations while presiding over two PILs challenging the procedure for selection of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Speaker.

136.title: Congress concedes defeat in Punjab elections as CM Channi congratulates AAP
136.article_body: Congress conceded defeat in the Punjab Assembly elections, with state CM Charanjit Singh Channi tweeting, "I humbly accept the verdict of the people of Punjab." "Congratulate Aam Aadmi Party and their elected CM Bhagwant Mann Ji for the victory. I hope they will deliver on the expectations of people," he wrote.

137.title: 'Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Channi? A mobile repair shop worker,' says Kejriwal
137.article_body: As trends show AAP's victory by a big margin in Punjab, AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said, "Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi? AAP candidate who works in a mobile repair shop." Kejriwal was referring AAP's Bhadaur candidate Labh Singh Ugoke. The CM was also defeated in Chamkaur Sahib by AAP's Charanjit Singh.

138.title: People voted for BJP's welfare works: Joshi on U'khand poll results
138.article_body: Union Minister and BJP's Uttarakhand election in-charge Pralhad Joshi said on Thursday that the people of Uttarakhand had endorsed PM Narendra Modi and CM Pushkar Singh Dhami's welfare policies. "The result was on expected lines. I want to thank the people...for...result," Joshi added. According to the latest trends, BJP is leading in 48 out of 70 Assembly seats in Uttarakhand.

139.title: BJP workers play holi in Lucknow office, say 'UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba'
139.article_body: As official trends predicted victory for the Bharatiya Janata Party in Uttar Pradesh polls, party workers played holi at the party office in Lucknow. They also raised slogans saying "UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba". Meanwhile, a kid dressed up as Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, carrying a bulldozer toy, also arrived at the party office in Lucknow.

140.title: Neymar is a clown and should go to fashion week instead: Daniel Riolo
140.article_body: Reacting to PSG being knocked out of the Champions League after a 2-3 defeat on aggregate against Real Madrid, French football pundit Daniel Riolo said Neymar is a "clown" and should go to "fashion week". "Neymar needs to be fired," added Riolo. "In July, there are the world poker championships. That's what he is good for," stated Riolo.

141.title: Noida Authority plans to build recreational park in Sector 94
141.article_body: The Noida Authority has proposed to build a recreational park in Sector 94 on about 20 acres of land. "Once the draft proposal is ready, it will be put before the authority's board in its next meeting scheduled in March-end," a senior official said. "Once approved, the project will be taken ahead," the official added.

142.title: Fought BJP & Cong: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate who defeated Parrikar's son
142.article_body: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate on Thursday defeated late Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal Parrikar from the Panaji constituency. He said, "I fought the unofficial candidate of the BJP (Utpal) as well as the Congress." He claimed the BJP cadre hasn't accepted him which is why Utpal got so many votes. "The BJP leadership...didn't manage to do damage control," he added.

143.title: 'EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? Just asking', tweets Ali Fazal
143.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal has tweeted, "Do din pehle counting ke, EVMs moved for training purposes? #Justasking (EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? #Justasking)." Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav had accused BJP of "stealing votes" and claimed that EVMs were being shifted in an unauthorised manner. UP's Chief Electoral Officer clarified that the EVMs were marked for training.

144.title: Intel suspends shipments to Russia, Belarus, condemns Ukraine invasion
144.article_body: Intel has suspended all shipments to customers in Russia and Belarus in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Intel condemns the invasion of Ukraine...Our thoughts are with everyone who has been impacted by this war," the firm said. Intel's announcement came after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov urged it to stop selling its solutions to Russia.

145.title: Amitabh Bachchan corporation abandoned me post my film Tere Mere Sapne: Arshad
145.article_body: Recently at Bachchhan Paandey's press conference, actor Arshad Warsi was asked about his godfather in Bollywood, Arshad said Amitabh Bachchan launched him with 'Tere Mere Sapne' in 1996. "I started my career with ABCL (Amitabh Bachchan Corporation Limited). But...[post my debut film]...they abandoned me," he added. "So I don't know what to call them. Godfather or what," he said.

146.title: Remove 'illegal' ramps built outside houses in Vasant Vihar: Delhi HC
146.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Police and SDMC to remove all illegal encroachments, including ramps and guard cabins, from public footpaths in Vasant Vihar. SDMC had reportedly issued about 460 notices to persons who'd constructed concrete ramps outside their houses upon the public footpath. Police is expected to remove all obstacles from a right of way, the court said.

147.title: I'll take oath as Punjab CM in Bhagat Singh's village: Bhagwant Mann
147.article_body: As trends predict poll win for AAP in Punjab, the party's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said that he'll take the oath of office in freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral village Khatkar Kalan, instead of at the Raj Bhawan. "No government office will have CM's photos, there'll be pictures of Bhagat Singh and Babasaheb Ambedkar," said Mann, who won from Dhuri.

148.title: Punjab will now run from its villages, borders, cities: AAP's Mann
148.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said Punjab will now be run from its villages, its borders and its cities. After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab polls, Mann said, "Sukhbir (Badal) has lost from Jalalabad...Captain (Amarinder) lost from Patiala....Channi has lost on both the seats. I had given to you in writing that they'll lose."

149.title: Live heart travels from Mysuru to Bengaluru in 2 hours 25 minutes
149.article_body: A live heart was transported from Mysuru's Apollo BGS Hospital to Bengaluru's Narayana Hrudayalaya Hospital covering 176 kilometres in 2 hours 25 minutes after a green corridor was provided by Bengaluru Police. Two ambulances were used in the process - one carrying live heart and the other as a backup. The organ was donated by a 40-year-old brain dead patient.

150.title: Reliance terminates lease of 950 Big Bazaar, Central stores: Future Group
150.article_body: Future Group companies have received notices from Reliance Industries to terminate the lease of nearly 950 stores due to non-payment of rent. Future Retail said it has received notices in respect of 835 large and small format stores, including Big Bazaar and Easyday. Future Lifestyle Fashions has received termination notices for 112 stores, including Central and Brand Factory stores.

151.title: BJP leads in Assam’s Majuli Assembly seat by-election
151.article_body: BJP has taken a massive lead in by-election in Assam's Majuli Assembly seat with candidate Bhuban Gam securing over 45,000 votes out of over 65,000 votes counted so far. He is leading with a margin of over 29,000 votes over Assam Jatiya Parishad's Chittaranjan Basumatary, who has only managed over 16,000 votes so far.

152.title: BJP's win is victory of their election management too: Shiv Sena's Raut
152.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said BJP's victory in the Assembly elections "is a victory of their election management too". "Congress party has lost badly in these elections. We didn't get the expected results," he added. Talking about AAP leading in the Punjab polls, Raut said, "In Punjab, people got another option and elected AAP."

153.title: It was the worst moment of my life: Zverev on outburst against umpire
153.article_body: Having been put on probation for a year for striking the chair of the umpire with his racket in the Mexican Open, world number three Alexander Zverev said, "It was...the worst moment of my life." "I can guarantee...I will never act this way again in my career," added Zverev. "If that happens again, you should ban me," stated Zverev.

154.title: CM Yogi likely to be made BJP Parliamentary Board member: Reports
154.article_body: As BJP closes in on to register a historic win in the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections, CM Yogi Adityanath is likely to be made a member of the BJP Parliamentary Board, suggest reports. He is likely to be inducted between March 18 to 20 in New Delhi. CM Yogi Adityanath is currently leading in Gorakhpur Urban by over 46,000 votes.

155.title: 2 men accused of sexually assaulting minor girl acquitted in Pune
155.article_body: A Pune court has acquitted two men who were accused of raping a minor girl in 2018. The acquittal was granted due to insufficient evidence against accused and a false statement by a prosecution witness, court order stated. The minor was found to be eight months pregnant in November 2018, after which hospital informed police and a case was filed.

156.title: Protest march held in Turkey against rights abuse in China
156.article_body: A protest march was held in Turkey's Istanbul against the alleged human rights violations in China on the occasion of International Women's Day. Thousands of women protesters marched holding Uyghur flags and raised slogans such as "stop the genocide" and "close the camps" in reference to the alleged persecution of Uyghur Muslims in China's Xinjiang.

157.title: 'One-in-a-million' 5-legged lamb born in UK, pic goes viral
157.article_body: A 'one-in-a-million' lamb has been born in a farm in Northumberland, UK, with an extra leg. The lamb was born in a set of triplets on February 22 or 22/2/22. Five-legged lambs are extremely rare and Heather Hogarty, co-owner of the farm, said it is only the second time she has seen it in her 25 years at Whitehouse Farm.

158.title: Mark Wood's 'solo huddle' pic goes viral after not being included in England team huddle
158.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood's reaction to not being included in England's team huddle during their Test match against West Indies has gone viral. England captain Joe Root called for the huddle after play resumed after a break due to rain. Wood, who was at the opposite side of the ground, made a 'solo huddle' gesture while looking at his teammates.

159.title: Yes: AAP on cricketer Jofra Archer's old 'Sweep?' tweet as trends show its win in Punjab
159.article_body: After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab Assembly polls, the party's official Twitter account quoted an old tweet of England cricketer Jofra Archer and reacted to it. Archer's tweet originally posted on February 20 read, "Sweep?!" Commenting on it, AAP wrote, "YES! #AAPSweepsPunjab." As per the latest trends, AAP is leading in 92 seats in Punjab Assembly polls.

160.title: I'm touched: Chiranjeevi on Indian doctor refusing to leave Ukraine without pets
160.article_body: Telugu actor Chiranjeevi has shared an open letter for the Indian doctor who refused to leave Ukraine amid the Russian invasion without his pet jaguar and panther. The actor wrote, "I'm...touched to learn that your love for jaguars and panthers was inspired by me...Your compassion and love for these wonderful creatures is highly admirable. I pray for your safety."

161.title: Hardik has qualities to become successful captain: GT's Director of Cricket
161.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki said Hardik Pandya has all the qualities to become a successful captain. "He has been part of our leadership group...has taken a lot of learnings from other captains like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli...MS Dhoni," he added. Hardik was picked as skipper of Ahmedabad-based franchise for ₹15 crore before IPL mega auction 2022.

162.title: Bihar government dependent on God's mercy: Tejashwi Yadav
162.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said the government of Bihar is "dependent on God's mercy". "There is no hearing and action," he said. Yadav further questioned the claims by Bihar government that said over 99% jobs were provided in the state under MGNREGA, saying, "Maximum number of youngsters and families from Bihar relocate for employment."

163.title: Liquor prices in Gurugram likely to increase by at least 10% from next week
163.article_body: Liquor prices in Gurugram are likely to increase by at least 10% from next Monday, vendors reportedly said. Vendors added that they were planning to withdraw discounts they had introduced earlier, a day after Delhi High Court refused to stay the Delhi government's order prohibiting discounts or rebates by liquor sellers in the national capital.

164.title: Amazon stops shipping products to Russia, suspends access to Prime Video
164.article_body: Amazon has stopped shipping retail products to its customers in Russia and Belarus amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. The company is also suspending access to Prime Video for its Russia-based customers. "We have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government," Amazon said, adding that it doesn't have offices or data centres in Russia.

165.title: COVID-19 took toll on my body, bones and stamina: Nora Fatehi
165.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi said that suffering from COVID-19 has taken a toll on her body, bones and stamina. "I am just so grateful for everything, I recovered from COVID-19 just recently so I hadn't danced, hadn't done anything physical since I've gotten sick," she said, adding, "I really started appreciating my health and the opportunities I'm getting."

166.title: Kurnool Police organises 'peace puja' of arms & weapons to curb crimes
166.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool Police organised a 'peace puja' and worshipped their arms and weapons to reduce the crime rate. Every police station in the area would conduct a puja to ensure peace and hassle-free work. But no such puja was performed at the police station since last year which made the policemen anxious about going to work amid increasing crimes.

167.title: Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi loses from both seats in Assembly elections
167.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi has lost from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur in the Assembly elections. Aam Aadmi Party's Labh Singh Ugoke has won from the Bhadaur seat, while the party's candidate Charanjit Singh has won from Chamkaur Sahib. Leaders including Navjot Singh Sidhu, Captain Amarinder Singh and Sukhbir Badal have congratulated AAP.

168.title: Russian convoy outside Kyiv has made little progress in over a week: UK
168.article_body: The miles-long Russian convoy of tanks and military equipment headed for Ukrainian capital Kyiv has made little progress over a week and "is suffering continued losses", UK Defence Ministry said. "There has been a notable decrease in overall Russian air activity over Ukraine in recent days, likely due to the unexpected effectiveness, endurance of Ukrainian Air Defence Forces," it added.

169.title: 40 supporters of ex-BJP corporator booked in Pune for raising slogans against Fadnavis
169.article_body: Around 40 supporters of a corporator who resigned from the BJP on Wednesday were booked by Pune Police for allegedly raising slogans, showing placards that read 'Fadnavis Go Back' during the ex-CM's visit to Bhosari. Ravi Landge was elected as a PCMC corporator on BJP's ticket but had quit the party amidst the ongoing spree of resignations of BJP corporators.

170.title: 5-time Punjab CM Parkash Badal loses his 1st Assembly poll since 1969
170.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal patriarch and five-time Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Gurmeet Singh Khudian from Lambi constituency on Thursday. Badal, 94, has not lost an Assembly election since 1969. Badal was also the oldest candidate to be contesting the 2022 Punjab Assembly polls. Earlier, Badal's son Sukhbir Singh Badal congratulated AAP for the victory.

171.title: Bhagwant Mann's mother breaks down, hugs him as trends show AAP's victory in Punjab
171.article_body: As trends show AAP's victory in Punjab, the party's CM face Bhagwant Mann's mother Harpal Kaur broke down in tears and hugged him on stage. The leader and his mother were greeting party workers in Sangrur. "Politicians and bureaucrats should learn to respect common man," Mann said at the event.

172.title: Holder-Bonner stand settles WI innings after a minor collapse
172.article_body: England bowlers faced stiff competition from the West Indies batters on Day 2 of the ongoing Antigua Test on Wednesday. The hosts had an 83-run stand for the first wicket but lost the next four wickets for 47 runs. Later, Jason Holder (43*) and Nkrumah Bonner's (34*) unbeaten stand of 75 runs put West Indies on 202/4 at stumps.

173.title: BJP cadre worked for Oppn candidate: BJP candidate from Panaji
173.article_body: BJP candidate from Goa's Panaji Atanasio Monserrate, who's currently leading in the constituency, on Thursday said, "BJP cadre didn't work for me but for Opposition candidate." Monserrate is ahead of former Goa CM late Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal Parrikar by 716 votes, according to ECI. "If [Utpal] can get so many votes, it's...because...cadre shifted their votes to him," he added.

174.title: It was a dream to be part of MI: Unadkat after arriving in Mumbai for IPL 2022
174.article_body: After arriving in Mumbai to prepare for the upcoming season of IPL, Jaydev Unadkat said it was a dream to be part of the MI. "I think Mumbai, in general, supports fast bowlers.
