So, looking forward to playing on all the grounds here," he said in a video posted on MI's YouTube channel. Unadkat was bought for ₹1.3 crore.

175.title: Ashneer bought Porsche, told BharatPe staff he spent $130,000 on a table: Report
175.article_body: Ashneer Grover, who's been removed from all positions at BharatPe over alleged misappropriation of funds, "purchased a Porsche" when he was at BharatPe and "told multiple people at the company he spent $130,000 on a dining room table," Bloomberg reported. "They (Ashneer & wife Madhuri) upgraded their modest home for a rented penthouse and renovated another luxury property," Bloomberg added.

176.title: Ranbir, Alia, Neetu attend Rishi's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' screening
176.article_body: The makers of Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' hosted a special screening of the comedy film on March 9 in Mumbai. The event was attended by Neetu Kapoor, Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Riddhima Kapoor, Shweta Bachchan, Aadar Jain and Randhir Kapoor. Directed by Hitesh Bhatia, the forthcoming film will also feature Juhi Chawla and Paresh Rawal.

177.title: Punjab will now run from its villages, borders, cities: AAP's Mann
177.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said Punjab will now be run from its villages, its borders and its cities. After AAP recorded a landslide victory in the Punjab polls, Mann said, "Sukhbir (Badal) has lost from Jalalabad...Captain (Amarinder) lost from Patiala....Channi has lost on both the seats. I had given to you in writing that they'll lose."

178.title: Russian commanders, officials will be held accountable for war crimes: UK
178.article_body: The UK government said that Russian commanders and top government officials will be held accountable for war crimes in Ukraine. "They [War crimes] are committed all the way down the chain of command by all who are involved and these atrocities are being watched, they're being catalogued and people will be held to account," said Armed Forces Minister James Heappey.

179.title: Mumbai-based Kuku FM raises $19.5 mn led by PUBG-maker KRAFTON
179.article_body: Mumbai-based audio content platform ﻿Kuku FM has raised $19.5 million in Series B funding led by PUBG-maker KRAFTON. Others who participated in the round include 3one4 Capital, Vertex Ventures, India Quotient, Founder Bank Capital and Verlinvest. With this funding, Kuku FM has secured a total of $25 million since its inception in 2018.

180.title: Beginning of honest politics in Goa: Kejriwal as AAP wins 2 seats
180.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday took to Twitter to announce that his party has won two seats in Goa Assembly elections. "Congratulations and best wishes to [party candidates] Capt Venzy [Viegas] and Cruz [Silva]. It is the beginning of honest politics in Goa," Kejriwal added.

181.title: Counting of 60% votes remaining in UP, difference on 100 seats is about 500 votes: SP
181.article_body: Samajwadi Party has claimed that 60% of the votes are still left to be counted as trends showed BJP leading on almost 250 out of 403 seats in UP Assembly elections. SP further claimed that the vote difference on 100 seats is around 500 votes. The party asked its office bearers and workers to stay careful till the final result.

182.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer apologises for 'celebrity' remark, says 'will sell peanuts if needed'
182.article_body: 'Kacha Badam' singer Bhuban Badyakar apologised for his remark wherein he said that he's a celebrity now and won't be selling peanuts anymore. "I've now realised that I shouldn't have said it. People have made me a celebrity and if situation arises I'll again sell peanuts," he stated. "I can assure you as a person I haven't changed," Bhuban added.

183.title: Warne texted me 8 hours before his death, I'll never delete that text: Gilchrist
183.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist has revealed that Shane Warne texted him around eight hours before his death. "He messaged me saying, 'Church, wonderful tribute to Rod Marsh. Well done on that sir'," Gilchrist said. He further said that it is a text message that he will never delete. Warne passed away aged 52 on March 4.

184.title: Accept Punjabis' mandate with humility, I congratulate AAP: SAD chief Sukhbir Badal
184.article_body: Amid counting of votes for the Punjab Assembly, SAD President Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted, "I congratulate AAP & their leader Bhagwant Mann on their victory in Punjab poll." With SAD currently leading in three seats, Badal said, "We whole-heartedly & with total humility accept the mandate given by Punjabis...We will continue to serve them with humility."

185.title: Pune Metro launches mobile app for ticket booking, fare enquiries
185.article_body: The Pune Metro has launched a mobile application to help people book tickets, enquire about the fares and feeder services among others, Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited said. The application, 'Pune Metro', is available for both iOS and Android users, it added. Using the application, people can generate a QR code digital ticket which can then be scanned at stations.

186.title: Celebrations begin at BJP office in Bengaluru amid counting of votes
186.article_body: Celebrations kicked off at BJP office in Bengaluru, Karnataka on Thursday as the official trends showed the party sweeping elections in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Goa and leading in Manipur. The counting of votes in all five poll-bound states including Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Manipur and Goa began on Thursday at 8 am.

187.title: Defeating BJP is equivalent to banging your head on wall: BJP's Chandrakant Patil
187.article_body: As counting of votes is underway in UP, Uttarakhand, Goa, Manipur and Punjab, BJP Maharashtra chief Chandrakant Patil said defeating BJP is equivalent to banging your head on a wall. "Early trends show that BJP will come in four states. All women must have voted for BJP and men might have voted for SP (in UP)," Patil added.

188.title: Fake news: Russia after Ukraine accuses it of bombing children's hospital
188.article_body: Russia refuted Ukrainian claims that it bombed the children's hospital in Mariupol as "fake news", saying the building was an ex-maternity hospital that had long been taken over by troops. Russia had warned on March 7 that the hospital was turned into a "military object" from which Ukrainians were firing, Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to UN, Dmitry Polyanskiy, said.

189.title: First human milk bank set up in Odisha
189.article_body: Odisha's first human milk bank has been set up in state's Capital Hospital for newborn whose mothers are unable to breastfeed them. Director of Capital Hospital said mothers' milk will be stored in facility and will be supplied to hospitals across state when the need be. "Some mothers are...unable to breastfeed their babies in...initial few weeks...bank will...be boon," director said.

190.title: You've fulfilled your responsibility, now it's my turn: Bhagwant Mann
190.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM face Bhagwant Mann on Thursday addressed supporters at his residence in Sangrur after his party's victory, saying that people have fulfilled their responsibilities and now it is his turn. He added that his biggest priority is job creation. "Why are Punjabi youths studying in Ukraine? Why can't we give them that education here?" he asked.

191.title: You gain one inch, they start commenting 'bhains', 'buddhi': Rubina on trolls
191.article_body: Actress Rubina Dilaik talked about being fat-shamed on social media and said that the moment you gain one inch, people start commenting, "Buddhi lagne lagi hai" and "Bhains hogayi hai." She added that people are inconsiderate about others' feelings. "People should know that respecting somebody's choice of being how they want to should be there," Rubina further said.

192.title: Used to conflict in Asia & Africa, alien to see in Europe: UK Prince on Ukraine war
192.article_body: Prince William's latest comments on the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, during his visit to the Ukrainian Cultural Centre in London, are being widely circulated online. Speaking to the volunteers, he said while Britons are used to seeing conflict in Asia and Africa, "It’s very alien to see this in Europe. We are all behind you." He added, "We feel so useless."

193.title: Mumbai teacher cheated by fraudster who threatened to share morphed pics of her
193.article_body: A 44-year-old teacher of a school in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹3.45 lakh by a cyber fraudster. The accused extorted money from her after threatening to send morphed pictures of her to her husband, friends and relatives. The woman alleged that she had received a message from the accused, following which they started chatting on a regular basis.

194.title: Siachen's first ice climbing festival organised in Ladakh
194.article_body: Siachen's first ice climbing festival was organised by Ladakh administration at Nubra valley in Leh, officials said on Wednesday. The festival aims to promote the glacier as an adventure spot and boost tourism in Ladakh. The festival will also let common people experience the extreme weather in inhospitable terrains and appreciate the work done by Army jawans, officials said.

195.title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway closed for traffic due to landslide
195.article_body: The Jammu-Srinagar national highway was closed for traffic on Thursday following a landslide in the Ramban district, officials said. "No fresh traffic was allowed either from Jammu or Srinagar in view of the closure of the highway," the officials added. Authorities have asked the people not to travel on the highway till the road clearance work gets completed.

196.title: Navjot Sidhu, Bikram Majithia lose to AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur from Amritsar East
196.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Majithia lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Jeevan Jyot Kaur from Amritsar East seat. Sidhu had earlier tweeted, "The voice of the people is the voice of God. Humbly accept the mandate of the people of Punjab. Congratulations to AAP !!!"

197.title: 25-year-old Jaipur woman robbed, stabbed to death by 4 men in Delhi
197.article_body: A 25-year-old woman from Jaipur was allegedly robbed and stabbed to death by four men in Shahbad Dairy area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. The deceased was called to Delhi on the pretext of work. According to police, the accused took her to an isolated park, where they stabbed her multiple times and fled with all her cash and jewellery.

198.title: When you are allowing sweat, why not saliva: Rajkumar Sharma
198.article_body: Talking about the new cricket laws announced by MCC, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said there was no need to ban applying saliva on the ball. "Bowlers should be given some liberty. There are so many dead tracks where there's nothing for bowlers...[so] even if bowlers [were] getting a little advantage, it's only fair for them," he explained.

199.title: Meteorite gouged 31 km-wide crater into Greenland 58 mn years ago: Study
199.article_body: The 31 km-wide crater that was discovered beneath Greenland's thick Hiawatha ice sheet in 2015 was formed due to the impact of a meteorite that struck the country 58 million years ago, researchers have found. Scientists took samples of sand from the crater and heated them. Using the argon gas thus released from the samples, they estimated its actual age.

200.title: Glacier slides down in Uttarakhand, covers 800 feet stretch of road
200.article_body: A glacier slid down in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh on Wednesday and covered nearly 800 feet stretch of the road. Road connectivity was interrupted as the villagers and defence personnel found it difficult to cover the stretch. "The route will be opened soon. Central Public Works Department officials have been asked to remove the ice and snow," Sub-divisional Magistrate of Dharchula said.

201.title: Ex-Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat loses to BJP's Mohan Singh Bisht from Lalkuwa
201.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat lost to BJP's Mohan Singh Bisht from Lalkuwa constituency in the 2022 Assembly elections. Rawat had lost from the Hardwar Rural and Kichha constituencies in the 2017 elections. As per the latest trends, BJP is winning 46 seats and Congress is winning 20 seats in 2022 Uttarakhand Assembly elections.

202.title: Wasn't lazy: Bobby on dad Dharmendra's comment he was lazy during Apne's shoot
202.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol spoke about how once his father Dharmendra Deol said he was "lazy" and unfit during Apne's shoot. Bobby said, "I wasn't lazy at all...I had...discussion with (Apne director) Anil Sharma. I told him, 'You can't start this film right away'." "He didn't listen...and it was...frustrating for me because I never...removed my shirt on-screen [before Apne]," Bobby added.

203.title: Cong lost Punjab due to indiscipline, tickets for notes: MP Jasbir Gill
203.article_body: Congress MP from Punjab Jasbir Singh Gill said that conflict and indiscipline within party are the reasons for Congress losing in Punjab polls. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Tickets for notes, workers disenchantment, inflated ego & arrogance of leaders have mauled Congress in Punjab." "The Congress high command should review the allotment of tickets and fix responsibility," he added.

204.title: Now Punjab will be known as Uthta Punjab not Udta Punjab: Raghav Chadha
204.article_body: AAP Punjab co-in charge Raghav Chadha on Thursday said that Punjab will not be known as "Udta Punjab" from now onwards but "Uthta Punjab". "All the credit goes to AAP workers, they didn't see day or night, summer or winter and continued working for the party," Chadha added. "AAP will work for everybody progressively," Chadha stated.

205.title: I couldn't sleep after finding out about Warne's demise: Wasim Akram
205.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, Wasim Akram said, "When I found out about him, I couldn't sleep that night. It is just unbelievable what...happened. I can't fathom it...like anyone else." "Every friend and colleague of Warne had one word to say about him and that is loyalty. He was a very loyal friend," added Akram.

206.title: Rhino census at Kaziranga National Park to be held from March 26-28
206.article_body: A census of the one-horned Rhino population at Kaziranga National Park in Assam will be held from March 26-28, the state Forest Department said on Wednesday. As per the guidelines, all tourist safaris, including jeep safari and elephant safari, will remain closed during the period. The Rhino population was recorded at 2,413 during the last census in 2018.

207.title: OnePlus Co-founder's Nothing raises $70 mn in Series B funding
207.article_body: OnePlus Co-founder Carl Pei's consumer-tech company Nothing has raised $70 million co-led by EQT Ventures and C Ventures. Others who participated in the funding include GV, Tony Fadell's Future Shape, Gaorong Capital and Animoca Brands. The new investment brings the total raised by Nothing to $144 million to date, including $1.5 million from its first community investment round.

208.title: Punjabis have voted above sectarian and caste lines, I congratulate AAP: Captain
208.article_body: While congratulating Aam Aadmi Party and Bhagwant Mann, former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh tweeted, "I accept the verdict of the people with all humility. Democracy has triumphed." "Punjabis have shown true spirit of Punjabiyat by rising and voting above sectarian and caste lines," he further said. Singh lost to AAP's Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from Patiala.

209.title: 3 held for throwing crude bomb during polling that killed 1 in UP
209.article_body: Three people were arrested on Wednesday in the crude bomb blast case in which one person was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. The trio was allegedly among those that threw a crude bomb from a graveyard opposite a polling booth in order to create a sensation on polling day, police said. A live bomb was also recovered from the graveyard.

210.title: Wanted to try hard, prove we could do it: Wood on absence of Anderson, Broad
210.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood said they tried a "bit too hard" as West Indies ended Day 2 at 202/4, trailing England by 109 runs, in their ongoing first Test. He added, "With the void of James Anderson and Stuart Broad we wanted to try hard, prove we could do it...we have to admit we didn't get it right to start."

211.title: CM Pramod Sawant wins in Sanquelim, says 'BJP will form government in Goa'
211.article_body: Goa CM and BJP leader Pramod Sawant has retained Sanquelim constituency by defeating Congress candidate Dharmesh Saglani by a margin of over 650 votes, reported All India Radio. He has sought Goa Governor's appointment to stake claim to form the next government. He said, "BJP will form the government in Goa. We will take MGP and Independent candidates with us."

212.title: Would rather be 'spicy' than someone who's 'pheeki': Malaika on 'sexy' tag
212.article_body: Malaika Arora, talking about being called 'sexy', said, "My God, I really held on to that tag!" The 48-year-old actress added, "It's like, when you bestow somebody a title or crown...you hang on to it forever...So, I guess, I've just hung on to this tag." "I've always said...I'd rather be known as...'sexy' and 'spicy'...than being known as 'pheeki'," Malaika said.

213.title: US woman killed by stalker who attached GPS tracker to her bike
213.article_body: A 21-year-old US woman, who was studying in the Netherlands, was allegedly stabbed to death by a stalker who attached a GPS tracker to her bike. Mieke Oort met the accused, Thomas R, on Tinder and had dated him briefly. The 27-year-old accused reportedly became violent and started stalking her after she decided to get back with her ex-boyfriend.

214.title: India suffer their first defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup, lose to hosts New Zealand
214.article_body: India suffered their first defeat in the 2022 Women's World Cup after losing to hosts New Zealand by 62 runs. Overall, it is India's 10th defeat in 13 matches against New Zealand in Women's World Cup history. The match witnessed India's Jhulan Goswami equal Australia's Lyn Fullston's record for taking most wickets in Women's World Cup (39 wickets).

215.title: BJP wins 1 seat, leading in 19 as per early trends in Manipur Assembly polls
215.article_body: The BJP has won one seat and is leading in 19 other seats in the 60-seat Manipur Assembly, according to early election trends. Early trends also show that JD(U) has won one seat in the state and is leading in three others. The Congress is leading in three seats, while the Naga People's Front (NPF) is leading in seven seats.

216.title: Fans decorate Prabhas' cut-out with garlands ahead of 'Radhe Shyam' release
216.article_body: Fans of actor Prabhas decorated his cutout with garlands ahead of the release of his film 'Radhe Shyam'. Prabhas had earlier apologised to his fans for keeping them waiting. He had said that there would be multiple releases from him. "I will work for 300 days a year to make it happen", the actor had said.

217.title: We didn't want to play into Australia’s hands: Raja on Rawalpindi pitch
217.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said the reason behind the Rawalpindi pitch used for Pakistan's first Test against Australia being flat, was to "not play" into Australia's hands by preparing a fast, bouncy pitch. "Pakistan...had limited resources for the Test and our bowling line up was disturbed as well," added Raja. Steve Smith had termed the pitch as "dead".

218.title: I don't come from a family with a big business & old money: Malaika
218.article_body: Malaika Arora said she doesn't come from a family with "big business" and "old money". She added, "The only thing I was thinking about is, if I am a single mother, I need to be a working single mother." Malaika said that she wanted to be a working single mother so she could take care of herself and her son.

219.title: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann wins Dhuri seat by defeating Dalvir Goldy
219.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann has won from the Dhuri seat by defeating Congress leader Dalvir Singh Goldy. Earlier, AAP's Punjab co-in charge Raghav Chadha said, "Punjab has proven that it likes the Arvind Kejriwal-Bhagwant Mann pair and no other party's pair...all other parties tried to defame us and called Kejriwal a terrorist."

220.title: SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar leads in UP's Zahoorabad
220.article_body: Samajwadi Party ally and Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar is currently leading in Uttar Pradesh's Zahoorabad seat with over 25,000 votes and a margin of over 10,000 votes over BJP candidate Kalicharan, who has secured over 15,000 votes so far. With over 12,000 votes, BSP's Saiyyada Shadab Fatima is just behind BJP.

221.title: SpaceX Polaris Dawn crew members to carry Ukraine's flag to space
221.article_body: The crew members of the upcoming SpaceX mission called 'Polaris Dawn' will carry Ukraine's flag to space as a sign of solidarity. It will be the debut mission of the Polaris Program, which so far includes three flights on SpaceX vehicles. "The...crew will take this flag to a place...that still remains beyond the reach of tyranny," program officials tweeted.

222.title: Indian Oil Corporation recruits 9 Indian women's hockey team members
222.article_body: Nine members of the Indian women's hockey team, which finished fourth at the last year's Tokyo Olympics, have been employed by the Indian Oil Corporation. The government-owned company has recruited these female hockey players as part of its policy to promote sports and women's hockey. Some of the notable mentions are Suman Devi Thoudam, Rajwinder Kaur, Rashmita Minz and Deepika.

223.title: EC lifts ban on victory processions on election results day in 5 states
223.article_body: Election Commission has lifted the ban on victory processions during the counting of votes and declaration of results in five states - Punjab, UP, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur. The Commission said keeping in mind the current status of COVID-19 in these states, it has "decided to relax the guidelines and has withdrawn the blanket ban on victory processions".

224.title: Our fight has just begun: Priyanka Gandhi ahead of UP poll results
224.article_body: Ahead of Uttar Pradesh Assembly election results, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday asked party workers to respect the people's mandate and "prepare for continuing our struggle". "Our fight has just begun," she said. Furthermore, she said that she is proud that party workers "remained committed to public service" despite Congress not being in power in the state.

225.title: Priyanka writes note to UP Congress workers, thanks their support
225.article_body: Senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra wrote a heartfelt note for the Uttar Pradesh Congress workers. Vadra thanked them "for their efforts during the UP Assembly elections campaign despite the party not being a major player in the state's politics for a long time now". She also asked the party workers to stay active at the counting centres on Thursday.

226.title: Despite trailing on his seat, Dty CM Maurya hopeful of 'a big win'
226.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya has tweeted that he is hopeful of "a big win" on his assembly seat of Sirathu (Kaushambi). The tweet has come after Maurya is witnessed to be trailing on his home turf by over 1,000 votes to Pallavi Patel who is a candidate fielded by the Samajwadi Party-led alliance.

227.title: Cloudy sky, light rain likely in Pune today: IMD
227.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted overcast conditions and light intensity rainfall in Pune and the entire region of Madhya Maharashtra on Thursday. The IMD has warned of thunder and lightning as well in the region. For the past two days, cloudy skies have prevailed over Pune and some parts of the city reported light rainfall as well.

228.title: Jailed SP veteran Azam Khan leads in Rampur with over 27,000 votes
228.article_body: Samajwadi Party veteran leader Azam Khan, who is currently lodged in Sitapur jail, is leading in Rampur assembly seat with a massive margin of over 27,000 votes. The rival BJP's Akash Saxena is trailing, having managed just over 4,000 votes so far. BJP is currently leading in over 250 seats, while SP is ahead in over 110 seats.

229.title: Congress workers protest against EVMs as party trails in all 5 states
229.article_body: Congress workers on Thursday protested against EVMs, outside the party office in Delhi as the counting for the Assembly polls is underway. The party is trailing in all five states as per the latest official trends by the ECI. The party workers were seen protesting with placards in their hands. "Democracy is being killed by EVMs," a placard read.

230.title: BJP not afraid of any election: Lekhi rebuts on Kejriwal's comment
230.article_body: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi said that her party is "not afraid of any election" after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal accused PM Narendra Modi of "being scared to hold Delhi municipal elections". The state election commission had recently deferred the announcement of the dates for the Delhi civic polls which prompted CM Kejriwal to barb at PM Modi.

231.title: Sidhu congratulates AAP on Punjab poll result, says 'Voice of the people is voice of God'
231.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu took to Twitter to congratulate AAP after trends showed AAP leading in 90 seats in the Assembly elections. "The voice of the people is the voice of God...Humbly accept the mandate of the people of Punjab...Congratulations to AAP!!!" he wrote. Congress is leading in 17 seats, as per trends.

232.title: Congratulations to people of Punjab for this revolution: Arvind Kejriwal
232.article_body: With Aam Aadmi Party leading in 90 seats in the Punjab Assembly elections, the party's chief Arvind Kejriwal tweeted a picture with Bhagwant Mann and wrote, "Congratulations to people of Punjab for this revolution." Leaders including Navjot Singh Sidhu, Charanjit Singh Channi, Parkash Singh Badal, Sukhbir Badal are trailing in their respective seats, as per trends.

233.title: DMK MP Elango's son killed in road accident near TN's Viluppuram; 1 injured
233.article_body: DMK Rajya Sabha MP NR Elango's son Rakesh Ranganathan died in a road accident in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram on Thursday early morning. Police said Rakesh, who was in his 20s, was on his way to Puducherry with a friend, when the vehicle they were travelling in hit a divider in a bid to avoid hitting a cow on the road.

234.title: Black Panther director Ryan Coogler mistaken for bank robber
234.article_body: Black Panther director Ryan Coogler was mistaken for a bank robber as he tried to take money out of his own account in US. Coogler walked into the bank wearing sunglasses and a face mask. He handed the teller a slip that asked for the money to be counted somewhere else, and read "I'd like to be discreet."

235.title: 2 teenagers arrested for breaking ATM, attacking cops in Pune
235.article_body: The Pune Police arrested two teenagers for allegedly breaking an ATM of IDBI Bank and attacking police personnel. The police found the two accused breaking an ATM at Hadapsar's Akashwani on Wednesday and while trying to nab them, the accused tried to attack the police with sharp weapons. Both the accused, identified as Prashant Kasbe and Tejas Jadhav, are 19-years-old.

236.title: Man wanting a son kills newborn daughter in Pak; manhunt launched
236.article_body: Police in Pakistan are hunting for a man who allegedly killed his seven-day-old baby girl because he wanted his firstborn to be a son. According to autopsy report the baby was hit by five bullets and was killed instantly, police said. The murder has sparked outrage on social media in Pakistan, as many condemned the killing as "barbaric" and "brutal".

237.title: I was deeply moved by Karan's reaction to my acting in 'Gangubai...': Alia
237.article_body: Terming filmmaker Karan Johar as similar to a "father", actress Alia Bhatt said she was "deeply moved" by his response to her performance in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "It was a very emotional moment for both of us," added Alia. "It...feels wonderful to be loved so much," stated Alia, who will be seen in SS Rajamouli's next film 'RRR'.

238.title: I don't care: Shweta on daughter Palak being called 'skinny', 'malnourished'
238.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari reacted to the body-shaming comments on her daughter Palak Tiwari. She said, "Even now people say she's so skinny but I never say anything to her...As long as she's healthy, she's good, I don't care what kind of body she has." "They used words like skinny and malnourished and what not. [But] I don't care," she added.

239.title: AIIMS Delhi to begin booster dose trial of nasal COVID vaccine
239.article_body: All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS), Delhi is all set to begin the booster dose trial of Bharat Biotech's intranasal COVID-19 vaccine from Friday. Only people who have received both the doses of either Covishield or Covaxin minimum five and maximum seven months back are eligible to take the booster dose, Dr Sanjay Rai from AIIMS said.

240.title: Ryzen™ 6000 Series mobile processors for leadership performance: AMD
240.article_body: AMD Ryzen™ 6000 series mobile processors with PRO technologies promise to deliver a new spectrum of performance & professional experiences for demanding business environments of any size. AMD revealed its PRO technologies have multi-layered security features that keep threats at bay, manageability options for any size of an organization & platform validation for long-term stability & reliability.

241.title: Nobody needs your thoughts: British actress Jameela on Kim Kardashian
241.article_body: Reacting to Kim Kardashian saying her best advice for businesswomen is to 'Get your f**king ass up and work', British actress Jameela Jamil tweeted, "Nobody needs to hear your thoughts on...work ethic." "This same 24 hours in the day shit is a nightmare," she added in the tweet. "It seems like nobody wants to work," Kim had further said.

242.title: Sony suspends PlayStation Store operation in Russia, halts shipments
242.article_body: Sony Interactive Entertainment has suspended the launch of the racing game "Gran Turismo 7" and operations of the PlayStation Store in Russia. Sony and Nintendo have suspended shipments of software and hardware to Russia following the invasion of Ukraine. Nintendo has also delayed the release of "Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp" because of "recent world events".

243.title: Bhagwant Mann visits Gurdwara, offers prayer ahead of counting
243.article_body: AAP's chief ministerial candidate Bhagwant Mann visited Gurdwara Gursagar Mastuana Sahib in Sangrur ahead of the start of the counting of votes on Thursday. "We are hopeful that the people of Punjab have voted for change (AAP)," said Mann after offering prayers at Gurdwara. Preparation of Jalebis is underway at Mann's residence in Sangrur.

244.title: Italian man living in Puri alleges defamation, threat to life
244.article_body: An Italian national, Alfredo Rombola who lives in Odisha's Puri registered a complaint alleging some people have created his fake IDs on social media. They tried to defame him and threatened to kill him and his family, he claimed. Alfredo has been living in India for over 25 years and runs an organisation that provides medical help to the poor.

245.title: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh loses to AAP's Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from Patiala
245.article_body: Former Punjab CM and Punjab Lok Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh has lost to Aam Aadmi Party leader Ajit Pal Singh Kohli from the Patiala seat in Assembly elections. Kohli, who quit the Shiromani Akali Dal party, joined Aam Aadmi Party in January this year. Kohli had said, "Akali leaders have no road map or policy for youth of Punjab."

246.title: It was a tough time: Lara recalls rejecting 'The Matrix' role in 2001
246.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta in a recent interview recalled rejecting a role in Keanu Reeves-starrer 'The Matrix' franchise in 2001 and said, "It was a tough time." She added that she just wanted to be with her mother at the time because she was "extremely unwell". "Therefore I did not even think twice and came back to India," Lara further said.

247.title: No water supply in several areas of Navi Mumbai on March 11-12
247.article_body: Several areas of Navi Mumbai will have no water supply as urgent repair will be carried out by Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (MJP) from Friday 10 am to Saturday 4 pm, CIDCO said. The water supply will be cut in Kalamboli, New Panvel, Kalundre and Karanjade nodes of CIDCO. The MJP will carry out repair work in the Feeder Main Pipeline.

248.title: 5 people booked in Bengaluru for acid attack on stray dog
248.article_body: Five people have been booked in Bengaluru for allegedly attacking a stray dog with acid, police said on Thursday. According to police, on March 4, the accused thrashed the dog in Ambedkarnagar after tying it up. They then allegedly poured acid and petrol on it. The accused also threatened a 50-year-old woman who questioned them, police added.

249.title: Satisfied with fight but result is disappointing: Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal
249.article_body: Former Defence Minister and Goa CM late Manohar Parrikar's son, Utpal Parrikar, who is contesting as an Independent from the Panaji Assembly Constituency is trailing behind BJP's Atanasio Monserrate by almost 700 votes, according to ECI. Parrikar said, "As an Independent candidate it was a good fight, I thank the people. Satisfied with the fight but result is little disappointing."

250.title: 'Har Ghar Jal' should be driven by society, not engineers: Union Minister
250.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said the scheme 'Har Ghar Jal' should be driven by the society, not engineers. "Despite disruptions and lockdown in...last two and a half years, we...managed to provide more than 5.91 crore tap water connections," the minister said at a conference on Wednesday. He added, over 47% village households are getting clean drinking water.

251.title: BCB rests Shakib Al Hasan from international cricket till April 30
251.article_body: The BCB has rested Shakib Al Hasan from all forms of international cricket till April 30 after the all-rounder requested a break, stating that he's "physically and mentally fatigued". "He told me...he is not enjoying any form of cricket...we want to give him complete rest and time with his family," BCB cricket operation chairman Jalal Yunus stated.

252.title: Manipur CM Biren leading in Heingang, ex-CM Okram in Thoubal as per early poll trends
252.article_body: As per early trends in Manipur Assembly elections, CM N Biren Singh is currently leading in Heingang constituency. Initial trends also show that former CM Okram Ibobi Singh is leading in Thoubal district. Currently, the BJP is leading in 25 seats, while the National People's Party (NPP) is leading in 13 seats. The Congress-led alliance is leading in 11 seats.

253.title: Shane Warne's eldest daughter Brooke shares pic with him, says 'Life is so cruel'
253.article_body: Ex-Australia spin legend Shane Warne's eldest daughter Brooke took to Instagram to share a throwback picture with her late father. "This doesn't feel real and doesn't make sense that you aren't here with us anymore...it doesn't feel right, you were taken away too soon and life is so cruel," she wrote. "I love you to infinity and back," she added.

254.title: 3 men harass policeman's wife, assault him when he objects in Pune
254.article_body: Three men have been arrested for allegedly harassing and passing lewd comments on a policeman's wife and then assaulting the policeman when he objected to it in Pune. The accused also apparently hit the policeman on the head with a stone. The policeman, who had been strolling with his wife when the incident occurred, reportedly was not in his uniform.

255.title: Kid dresses up as Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann on poll results day in Punjab
255.article_body: As counting of votes began in Punjab on Thursday, a child of an Aam Aadmi Party supporter dressed up as AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and AAP's Punjab Chief Minister face Bhagwant Mann. The kid can be seen wearing a muffler and a yellow turban. Meanwhile, Early trends in counting showed AAP crossing halfway mark in Punjab.

256.title: Positive trends seen in Punjab, we hope results will also be positive: AAP's Gopal Rai
256.article_body: As the counting of votes is underway in Punjab, AAP leader Gopal Rai on Thursday said, "We can witness positive trends in Punjab and we hope the results will also be positive." Rai added, "I thank the people of Punjab for voting for change." AAP has crossed the majority mark with an early lead in 89 Assembly constituencies in Punjab.

257.title: Rohit Sharma is the only player who gave me sleepless nights: Gambhir
257.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Rohit Sharma is the "only" player who gave him "sleepless nights", with neither Chris Gayle nor AB de Villiers being able to do so. "There is no more successful cricketer in the history of IPL than Rohit as captain," added Gambhir. Rohit Sharma helped MI win the IPL for a record-extending fifth time in IPL 2020.

258.title: 'Scam 1992' actor Hemant Kher shares pic of his physical transformation
258.article_body: Actor Hemant Kher, known for playing Ashwin Mehta in 'Scam 1992' took to social media to share picture of his physical transformation. "Here are glimpses of new me! The process of losing weight is a joyful phenomenon! I'm experiencing it every day! And the journey is on! I'd like to thank lot of people for guiding...me," he said.

259.title: EU Parliament votes to end 'golden passports' amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
259.article_body: In the wake of Russia's attack on Ukraine, the European Parliament on Wednesday voted to end the practice of offering citizenships to rich individuals through "golden passport" schemes. The members called for a complete ban on purchase of citizenship by 2025 and insisted on bringing increased background checks immediately. The vote, however, is not binding at this point.

260.title: Tamil Nadu launches counselling service for Ukraine returnees
260.article_body: Around 40 counsellors have been deployed to counsel students who had returned from war-torn Ukraine in Tamil Nadu and their parents. Seven WhatsApp groups have been formed and the students were counselled based on concerns they have raised, state Health Minister Ma Subramanian said. "Whatever humanitarian support they need, we will give...The counsellors will be working round-the-clock," he added.

261.title: Rajasthan is a state of men: Minister on state being at top in rape cases
261.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal has said, "We are number 1 when it comes to rape cases. Why is it so?...Rajasthan has been a land of men. What we can do about it?" Dhariwal later claimed it was "slip of tongue" and said he'd apologise in Assembly. He added, "I've always respected women and encouraged them to participate in everything."

262.title: Alia transformed in 5 minutes, I said she's going to be Gangubai: Bhansali
262.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, in an interview with actress Alia Bhatt, said that she transformed "in five minutes" and that he said "this is going to be the girl for Gangubai". "I told you to wear white saree...we brought you out...put red bindi on you...we tied hair...I was doing Gangubai look test...I said what is this transformation?" he added.

263.title: Can't make a misstep: Siddharth Anand on helming SRK's film Pathaan
263.article_body: Filmmaker Siddharth Anand spoke about helming Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie Pathaan which will be known as the actor's comeback film after four years. Siddharth revealed the pressure is intense to deliver but he loves it. "We have the most-loved superstar of our generation...It's an honour and a responsibility for us. So, we can't make a misstep," he added.

264.title: 35,000 civilians evacuated on Wed, more corridors planned: Zelenskyy
264.article_body: Around 35,000 civilians were evacuated through humanitarian corridors from Ukrainian cities of Sumy, Enerhodar and Kyiv on Wednesday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Authorities plan to open another six escape routes on Thursday, he added. Zelenskyy said the rescue effort would focus on Mariupol and Izyum, which have been heavily bombarded. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

265.title: Hyd police intercept lorry, seize 20,980 kg PDS rice; 2 arrested
265.article_body: Hyderabad City Police have arrested two people and seized 20,980 kg of Public Distribution System (PDS) rice after they intercepted a lorry beside Amarjyothi Weighing Bridge in Balanagar on Wednesday. The accused allegedly used to buy PDS rice from ration card holders for ₹5/kg, transported it for ₹12/kg and earned illegal profits, the police said. Two other accused are absconding.

266.title: This is the victory of 'Aam Aadmi': Manish Sisodia as trends show AAP leading in Punjab
266.article_body: With latest trends showing that AAP is leading in 89 seats in the 117-seat Punjab Assembly, AAP leader and Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said, "Punjab has given chance to Arvind Kejriwal's model of governance." He added, "Today, his model of governance has been established at the national level. This is the victory of the 'Aam Aadmi' (common man)."

267.title: Celebrations begin at AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence
267.article_body: Celebrations began at AAP's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's residence in Sangrur on Thursday as early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections shows that AAP has crossed the majority mark in the state. Mann is leading from Dhuri seat, according to early poll trends. He is leading over his nearest rival and Congress candidate Dalvir Singh Goldy.

268.title: Admissions for nursery quota seats in Delhi to start from March 22
268.article_body: The admission process of the entry-level seats in Delhi's private schools for the Economically Weaker Section (EWS)/Disadvantaged Groups (DG) and Children with Special Needs (CWSN) categories will start online from March 22, officials said. The last date for filing the application is April 4 and the first round of computerised draw of lots will be conducted on April 11.

269.title: Bhagwant Mann leading with 43,000+ votes in Dhuri, Sukbhir Badal trailing in Jalalabad
269.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) CM candidate Bhagwant Mann is leading in Dhuri with over 43,000 votes, as per early trends. Shiromani Akali Dal leader Sukhbhir Badal is trailing in Jalalabad, while Congress leader Manpreet Singh Badal is trailing in Bathinda Urban. Meanwhile, Congress leader Vijay Inder Singla is trailing in Sangrur.

270.title: Jhulan Goswami becomes joint-highest wicket-taker in Women's WC history
270.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami has become the joint-highest wicket-taker in the Women's ODI World Cup history. She equalled the tally of 39 wickets taken by Australia's Lyn Fullston after dismissing Katey Martin during India's match against New Zealand in the ongoing 2022 World Cup. Jhulan finished with 1/41 as New Zealand posted 260/9 in 50 overs.

271.title: Kyiv Mayor's brother releases NFT collection to raise funds for Ukraine
271.article_body: Former Ukrainian professional boxer and Kyiv Mayor's brother Wladimir Klitschko is releasing an NFT collection to support Ukraine. The collection titled 'Vandalz for Ukraine: WhIsBe x Wladimir Klitschko' will be available at the $100, $1,000, and $10,000 price points and a 1-of-1 NFT will be sold for $1 million. Sale proceeds will be donated to Red Cross Ukraine and UNICEF.

272.title: BSF, Punjab Police recover drone along Indo-Pak border in Tarn Taran
272.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) along with Punjab Police recovered a drone from a farm along the India-Pakistan international border at Tarn Taran's Hawelian village on Wednesday. The BSF troops opened fire at the drone that was spotted near pillar number 124/48 after crossing the border on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday.

273.title: SGPC criticises ban on Sikh staff from wearing 'kirpan' at airports
273.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) on Wednesday said that it's taking "strict notice" of Sikh employees at airports being barred from wearing 'kirpan'. "In their own country, this discrimination is a major attack on...religious freedom of Sikhs," SGPC President Harjinder Singh Dhami said. Dhami has written a letter to Union Civil Aviation Minister to withdraw an order on the same.

274.title: Musk sends 2nd Starlink terminals shipment to Ukraine, Vice PM shares pic
274.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov on Thursday shared a picture of Ukraine getting its second Starlink terminals shipment, saying, "Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" Replying to Mykhailo, Musk said SpaceX has also sent power adapters for car cigarette lighters, solar/battery packs and generators for places with no electricity.

275.title: I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows: Mrunal
275.article_body: Responding to a query about criticism faced by her for her looks, actress Mrunal Thakur said, "There were times when I was called a caterpillar because of my thick bushy eyebrows." "People told me, 'You are heavy on thighs'. I simply say, 'Yes, I am an Indian and this body is for Indian wear. Do you have...problems?'," added Mrunal.

276.title: Opposition candidate Yoon Suk-yeol wins presidential election in South Korea
276.article_body: Yoon Suk-yeol, the opposition candidate, has won the presidential election in South Korea, defeating the incumbent Lee Jae-myung of the ruling Democratic Party. Yoon bagged 48.59% of the votes while Lee secured 47.80% of the votes. Conceding the defeat, Lee said, "I did my best, but I did not live up to expectations."

277.title: Immensely proud: Riddhima on dad Rishi Kapoor's last film Sharmaji Namkeen
277.article_body: On Wednesday, makers of 'Sharmaji Namkeen' took to their social media handles to announce the release date of late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film. Taking to Instagram, Rishi Kapoor's daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a post for him. She wrote, "Today, as I watch the last film of my father...I feel immensely proud...Paresh ji thank you for completing the movie."

278.title: Wasn't allowed same privileges as male actors, fought for acceptance: Sushmita
278.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen said she wasn't allowed to have the same privileges or opportunities that male actors had. "I've had to fight as a woman for many levels of acceptance...I'm older now, so I do have experience and reputation which has taken me years to build," she said, adding, "With experience, you are slowly changing the world."

279.title: 2 held in Hyderabad for cheating people on pretext of online trading
279.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Wednesday arrested two persons for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of online trading. They were arrested after a victim was duped of ₹8.2 lakh, reported Telangana Today. According to police, the accused floated fraudulent firms and offered huge returns in a short span of time. However, after collecting money they shut down the firms, police added.

280.title: Tanzanian national held with heroin worth ₹32 cr at Ahmedabad airport
280.article_body: A Tanzanian national was arrested with 4.5 kg of heroin worth ₹32 crore at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International airport in Ahmedabad by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI). Four packets containing a brown powdery substance were found in his luggage which turned out to be heroin on preliminary tests. The accused had arrived from Sharjah on Wednesday, DRI said.

281.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per latest trends?
281.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in 259, SP in 128 and BSP in 7 seats in UP Assembly elections. In Punjab, AAP is leading in 89, Congress in 13, SAD in 9 and BJP in 5 seats. In Uttarakhand Assembly, BJP is leading in 42 seats and Congress in 23. BJP is leading in 18 seats in Goa.

282.title: Odisha CM announces ₹3 lakh ex gratia as 2 die in bridge collapse
282.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has expressed grief after two people died and one was injured when a portion of a bridge collapsed at Cuttak's Chhatra Bazar on Wednesday. Patnaik also announced an ex gratia of ₹3 lakh for the deceased's families. "We will continue rescue operations to ensure that no one is left under the debris," DCP Prateek Singh said.

283.title: Aamir always gets over-excited: Big B on him crying after seeing 'Jhund'
283.article_body: Reacting to actor Aamir Khan bursting into tears after watching his film 'Jhund', Amitabh Bachchan joked that Aamir "always" has the habit of getting "over-excited". "Aamir has always been a very good judge of films," added Amitabh. "I remember when I discussed ['Jhund']...with Aamir, he told me I must do this film," Amitabh had earlier said.

284.title: Anti-incumbency to increase against Gehlot after poll results today: BJP
284.article_body: Rajasthan BJP incharge Arun Singh said that anti-incumbency against the state's Congress government will intensify after the Assembly poll results today, adding that the countdown for the end of Ashok Gehlot-led government has started. Gehlot makes promises daily but nobody knows how will he keep them, Singh added. Congress will not get even five seats in UP, Singh further said.

285.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reaches counting centre in Panaji
285.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant reached a counting centre in Panaji on Thursday morning as counting of votes began for the recently held Assembly polls. Sawant was apprised about the security measures in place by the police officials. Sawant stated that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

286.title: Soldiers of democracy should return with victory certificate: Akhilesh Yadav
286.article_body: As the counting of votes is underway in UP, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday said, "Soldiers of democracy should return with a victory certificate." "Thank you from the bottom of my heart to every single worker, supporter, leader, office bearer and well-wisher of the SP-alliance for being alert and vigilant at the counting centres day and night," Yadav tweeted.

287.title: When 'Aam Aadmi' rises, thrones shake: Raghav Chadha on poll results day
287.article_body: While counting of votes remains underway, Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab co-incharge Raghav Chadha said, "When 'Aam Aadmi' rises mightiest of thrones shake. Today's an important day in India's history, not only because AAP is winning one more state but because it has become a national force. AAP will become Congress' replacement," he added.

288.title: Ukrainian envoy urges UK to relax visa rules for refugees fleeing war
288.article_body: The Ukrainian envoy in UK urged the government to suspend visa requirements for refugees fleeing Ukraine to escape Russian attack. This comes after the UK government acknowledged that fewer than 1,000 visas have been processed out of 22,000 applications so far. If the government gives temporary relief, we will take care of the refugees, said Ambassador Vadym Prystaiko.

289.title: Indonesia's Merapi volcano unleashes lava, forcing hundreds to evacuate
289.article_body: Merapi volcano in Indonesia erupted overnight, sending hot lava and ash down its slopes and forcing over 250 residents in the surrounding area to evacuate, the country's disaster mitigation agency said on Thursday. The agency also warned people living within 7 km of the volcano to keep away. The 2,963 metre-high Merapi is one of Indonesia's most active volcanoes.

290.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant trailing in early trends; Utpal Parrikar, Amit Palekar also trailing
290.article_body: Goa CM and BJP candidate from Sanquelim, Pramod Sawant, is trailing by around 300 votes in Assembly elections, according to early trends. Congress candidate Dharmesh Saglani is leading from Sanquelim. Former Union Minister and Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son, Utpal Parrikar, who had quit BJP to contest from Panaji is also trailing. AAP's CM face Amit Palekar	is also trailing.

291.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami, Harish Rawat trailing as per early trends in U'khand polls
291.article_body: As per early trends in Uttarakhand Assembly elections, BJP candidate and Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing in the Khatima Assembly constituency. Trends further show that former Uttarakhand Chief Minister and Congress leader Harish Rawat is also trailing in the Lalkuwa Assembly constituency. As per the early trends, the BJP is leading with 47 seats in the state.

292.title: Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy to be adapted into web series
292.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi's Shiva Trilogy is being adapted into a web series. International Art Machine has acquired the rights to his Shiva Trilogy, which includes the books 'The Immortals of Meluha', 'The Secret of the Nagas' and 'The Oath of the Vayuputras'. Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has been roped in to direct the first instalment 'The Immortals of Meluha'.

293.title: Sitting CMs of Punjab, Goa and Uttarakhand trailing in early trends in Assembly polls
293.article_body: As per early trends in Assembly elections, the sitting Chief Minister of Punjab, Charanjit Singh Channi, is trailing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur seats. Goa CM Pramod Sawant is trailing from Sanquelim seat. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is trailing from Khatima, as per early trends.

294.title: Yogi Adityanath, Akhilesh Yadav leading in early trends in UP polls, SP Maurya trailing
294.article_body: As per the early trends in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is leading by a huge margin in the Gorakhpur Urban seat, while Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is leading in Karhal constituency. Swami Prasad Maurya, who joined SP from BJP ahead of the 2022 polls, is trailing from Fazilnagar.

295.title: Knew I had to take on being single mom; felt scared, vulnerable: Malaika
295.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora said she did not pause after she decided to become a single mother. "You always feel...the whole world is crashing on your head...I knew it is something I have to take on...I have to be responsible...I did feel scared, vulnerable, frightened. But I also felt that I had to take one day at a time," she added.

296.title: Punjab teacher absent from duty for 5 months, disciplinary action taken
296.article_body: The district education department of Punjab's Mohali has initiated disciplinary action against Karala school teacher, Karamjit Singh, who has not reported for duty since last five months. "We found that he has not been reporting for work since October last year. We will charge sheet him under Rule 8 of Punjab Civil Services Rules and initiate inquiry," an official said.

297.title: Want to focus on spiritual journey: Anupamaa's Anagha takes break from acting
297.article_body: TV actress Anagha Bhosale, known for playing Nandini in show 'Anupamaa', revealed that she's taking a break from acting. She said she "couldn't relate to...double standards in showbiz and the pressure to be something that you are not". Anagha added she has been "a very spiritual person" and wants to focus on her spiritual journey and "follow Lord Krishna's teachings".

298.title: Djokovic withdraws from Indian Wells, Miami, says he can't play in the US
298.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has confirmed his withdrawal from ATP Masters tournaments in Indian Wells and Miami due to COVID-19 regulations in the US. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter the country and Djokovic remains unvaccinated. "Regulations won't be changing so I won't be able to play," Djokovic tweeted.

299.title: Issue caste certificate to adopted boy based on mother's caste: Bombay HC
299.article_body: The Bombay HC directed Dharavi's Deputy Collector to issue a caste certificate to the adopted son of a single mother, assigning him the same caste as her. In 2016, the 44-year-old doctor applied for a caste certificate for her adopted son which was rejected by the Deputy Collector, saying her documents could not be accepted for assigning the same caste.

300.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 tattoo artists for drug peddling
300.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested two tattoo artists and their helper for drug peddling. According to police, accused Sigil Varghese and Vishnupriya had come to Bengaluru from Kerala for their studies. They have been involved in drug peddling since 2020 and sold drugs from Kerala and Coimbatore to students at various prestigious colleges in Bengaluru, police added.

301.title: Don't let Ukraine become another Syria, urge UN investigators
301.article_body: The UN Commission of Inquiry on Syria has urged world leaders to work to ensure that Ukraine doesn't become another war-torn country like Syria. "We can only hope that world leaders are doing everything now that they can to avoid a similar fate for Ukraine," said Commission Chair Paulo Pinheiro. The Commission expressed serious concerns over civilian casualties in Ukraine.

302.title: China-Taiwan war would end in miserable victory: Taiwan Defence Min
302.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Minister Chiu Kuo-cheng on Thursday said no matter who wins in any future war between Taiwan and China, it will be a "miserable victory". He added that it was best for everyone to "avoid wars". China claims the democratically governed island as its own and has pledged to bring it under Chinese control, by force if necessary.

303.title: Akshay returns on Kapil's show post rumours of rift, calls him 'unfaithful'
303.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar returned to 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film, Bachchhan Paandey days after several reports suggested an alleged rift between the duo. Sharing a video on Instagram, Akshay calls Kapil "unfaithful". Alongside the video, he wrote, "We all have an unfaithful person in our lives. In my life, it is Kapil Sharma, who is yours?

304.title: Captain, Sidhu, Channi, Parkash Singh Badal trailing in early trends in Punjab polls
304.article_body: As per early trends in Punjab Assembly elections, former Punjab CM and Punjab Lok Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh is trailing in Patiala. Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu is trailing in Amritsar East and Charanjit Singh Channi is trailing in both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Meanwhile, SAD leader Parkash Singh Badal is trailing in Lambi.

305.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in UP, U'khand and Goa; AAP in Punjab
305.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Assembly elections show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa. Further, the trends show AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab. BJP is leading in 240 seats in Uttar Pradesh, 47 seats in Uttarakhand and 21 seats in Goa, as per trends. AAP is leading in 84 seats in Punjab.

306.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttarakhand Assembly elections
306.article_body: Early trends in counting of votes in Uttarakhand Assembly elections are showing that the BJP is ahead with 35 seats in the state. Trends further show that the Congress party is leading in 22 seats, while AAP is leading in one seat. The counting of votes in the 70-constituency state started at 8 am on Thursday.

307.title: BJP crosses majority mark in Goa Assembly elections, as per early trends
307.article_body: BJP is leading in 21 out of the 40 Assembly seats in Goa, according to the early trends. Congress party is leading in nine Assembly seats, trends showed. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's TMC party is leading in four seats, while Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's AAP is leading in one seat, as per the trends.

308.title: 2 West Bengal BJP MLAs suspended for disrupting Governor's address
308.article_body: Two West Bengal BJP MLAs were suspended from attending the Assembly for the rest of Budget session on Wednesday after they created disturbances in the House during state Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address on March 7. The suspended lawmakers are Natabari MLA Mihir Goswami and Purulia MLA Sudip Mukherjee. This comes as Dhankhar accused female TMC legislators of misbehaving with him.

309.title: Game streaming platform Loco raises $42 mn led by S Korea's Hashed
309.article_body: Game streaming platform Loco has raised $42 million led by South Korea's early-stage venture fund, Hashed. Others who participated in the round include, Makers Fund, Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures, Korea Investment Partners, Krafton, Lumikai and Hiro Capital. Loco had raised $9 million in a funding round in June 2021 led by PUBG parent Krafton.

310.title: Early trends show BJP crossing majority mark in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections
310.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections show BJP crossing the majority mark of 202 in the state. BJP is leading in 225 seats, while SP is leading in 93 seats. BSP is leading in 7 seats in the state and Congress is leading in 5 seats, the trends showed.

311.title: Sensex opens over 1,200 points higher amid counting of votes in Assembly elections
311.article_body: Sensex surged over 1,200 points to open at over 55,770 on Thursday amid counting of votes in Assembly elections for five states. The broader Nifty was up 314.20 points or 1.92% at 16,659.60. Around 1,860 shares have advanced, 185 shares declined, and 38 shares are unchanged. Asian Paints and Axis Bank jumped up to 5%.

312.title: Kid in 'Jhund' asked 'how does one cry', he was beyond crying: Amitabh
312.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said one of the kids in the film 'Jhund' asked him how does one cry before a scene. “Kid had reached a point where he was beyond crying. He may have never cried in life...Probably his circumstances and the way he lived...were so harsh...maybe he was beyond crying. That moment stayed with me for long,” he added.

313.title: 2,270 FIRs filed in 5 states for COVID norms, MCC violations: CEC
313.article_body: As many as 2,270 FIRs were filed for violation of COVID-19 protocol norms as well as MCC violation in all five states during the ban on poll rallies, Sushil Chandra, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC), said. "During the ban on election rallies due to the Omicron wave, EC took MCC violations seriously…Every political party is the same for EC," Chandra added.

314.title: Fire breaks out in Bengaluru’s Sukh Sagar Hotel; no casualties reported
314.article_body: A fire broke out in Sukh Sagar Hotel located in Bengaluru's Gandhinagar area on Wednesday afternoon. Thick, black smoke was seen rising from the top floor of the hotel which was adjacent to a mall. No casualties were reported in the incident. Two fire engines were rushed to the site and it took about four hours to douse the fire.

315.title: Early trends show AAP crossing halfway mark in Punjab Assembly elections
315.article_body: Early trends in the counting of votes in Punjab Assembly elections show Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) crossing halfway mark in the state. AAP is leading in 68 seats, while Congress is leading in 15 seats. Shiromani Akali Dal is leading in 8 seats in the state and BJP is leading in 5 seats, as per the trends.

316.title: India reports 4,184 new COVID-19 cases, 104 deaths in last 24 hours
316.article_body: India has reported 4,184 new COVID-19 cases and 104 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,575 cases and 145 deaths. Out of the 104 deaths, 33 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 71 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

317.title: No question of tampering with EVMs: Chief Election Commissioner
317.article_body: After SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that EVMs were being stolen in UP, Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra said there's no question of EVM tampering as Election Commission has always maintained transparency. UP Chief Electoral Officer suspended Varanasi ADM because he hadn't followed the procedures to inform political parties about the movement of EVM for training purposes, Chandra added.

318.title: Proof of genocide: Ukraine Prez on Russia bombing children's hospital
318.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the bombing of the children's hospital by Russia is "the final...proof that a genocide of Ukrainians is taking place". Zelenskyy called on Europeans to "increase sanctions against Russia so that it no longer has any opportunity to continue this genocide".  The attack in Mariupol had injured women in labour and left children in the wreckage.

319.title: Chandigarh's PGIMER to send lab reports to patients via SMS
319.article_body: Chandigarh's PGIMER has launched an SMS facility to update patients about their laboratory reports. As part of its patient-friendly initiative, the patients would now get an SMS on their registered mobile phone numbers once their lab test reports are ready. They can view and download the PDF file of their report using the hyperlink given in the text SMS.

320.title: Delhi HC notice to Centre on Waqf Board's petition regarding 123 properties
320.article_body: The Delhi High Court issued notice to the Centre on Delhi Waqf Board's petition related to 123 properties which mainly include mosques and Muslim graveyards. These properties were to be reverted to the Waqf Board in 2014. The Waqf Board has told the court that Centre is giving these properties to other agencies like ITBP.

321.title: Goa CM offers prayers at Shree Datta Mandir ahead of poll results
321.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly poll results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant offered prayers at the Shree Datta Mandir in his constituency, Sanquelim. This is done in line with traditions set by his predecessor and ex-Union Minister Manohar Parrikar. Addressing media on Wednesday, Sawant expressed confidence that the BJP will be forming the next government in the state.

322.title: Congress will win almost 48 seats in Uttarakhand: Harish Rawat
322.article_body: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said his party will comfortably win the Uttarakhand Assembly polls by bagging almost 48 seats. "I am confident of Congress' victory in Uttarakhand. Everything will be clear in the next two to three hours," Rawat added. The counting of votes for the recently held polls for the 70-member Uttarakhand Assembly commenced at 8 am.

323.title: Man City reach their 5th straight Champions League quarterfinals
323.article_body: Manchester City reached their fifth straight Champions League quarterfinals despite playing out a goalless draw against Sporting CP in the last-16 second leg on Wednesday night. City advanced 5-0 on aggregate due to their victory in the first-leg. The Pep Guardiola side have reached the last eight along with Bayern Munich, Liverpool and Real Madrid.

324.title: 40-yr-old man sets wife ablaze suspecting extra-marital affair in Chennai, held
324.article_body: The Chennai city police arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly setting his wife ablaze, suspecting her of having an extra-marital affair. The victim suffered serious burns and was admitted to a hospital. On Monday, the accused came to the house and picked up a fight with his wife. He poured kerosene on her and set her on fire, police said.

325.title: Central Railway commuters to have access to trains' live-location in Mumbai
325.article_body: Commuters of Central Railway in Mumbai will be able to track live locations of trains before boarding. Location would be available on the Yatri application of the railways. Field trials of tracking live locations of locals was conducted on Belapur-Kharkopar route. "We have developed...in-house algorithm to get real-time location of local trains," an official said.

326.title: Hung out with friends with Haryanavi accent: Sumeet on Jugaadistan preparation
326.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he spent time with friends with "very heavy Haryanavi accent" for preparation of role in television series 'Jugaadistan'. "I was very scared of the accent...They wanted me to speak in way that is understandable by most people...I had few friends who are from that region...I was hanging out with them...don't think they were aware," he said.

327.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per early trends?
327.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls with 115 seats. AAP is leading in 24 seats in 117-member Punjab Assembly. In Uttarakhand, BJP is leading in 25 seats, while Congress is leading in 20 seats. In Goa, BJP is leading in 8 seats, while in Manipur, BJP is leading in 4 seats.

328.title: Never considered acting as a career; was more inclined towards business: Navya
328.article_body: Speaking to Barkha Dutt in an interview, actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said she never considered acting as a career. "I was always...inclined towards business. My grandmother and aunt were both working women," she added. "I am also the fourth generation of the Nandas to take over that. I really wanted to carry that legacy forward," Navya said.

329.title: 2 brothers force wives to drink 'black water' to have sons in Pune
329.article_body: Two twin brothers have been booked for alleged domestic violence and using black magic against their twin wives in Pune. According to complaint, the wives alleged that their husbands and in-laws did things like making them drink blackened water so they'd produce a son. One wife was pregnant when superstitious activity was done, DCP (Zone 3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

330.title: 70-yr-old patient's gold bangle stolen at Chandigarh's PGIMER
330.article_body: A 70-year-old patient's gold bangle was stolen while she was waiting for doctor's consultation outside the urology department of PGIMER's New OPD block on Tuesday. The accused used a cutter to remove the bangle from the patient's wrist, police said. "We will check the CCTV footage and try to find the culprit," Kumar Gaurav Dhawan, deputy director (administration), PGIMER said.

331.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for cheating cinema aspirants in Hyderabad
331.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs in the film industry. According to police, a victim filed a complaint after he was duped of ₹90,000. The accused had introduced himself as a manager and assistant director at Ramoji Film City and hosted an app named 'Cine Drive-In', police added.

332.title: 68-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of ₹11 lakh by Nigerian man on pretext of marriage
332.article_body: A 28-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for cheating a 68-year-old widow from Mumbai of ₹11 lakh by posing as a UK-based businessman and promising to marry her and take her abroad with him. The accused met the victim on Facebook. As per reports, he allegedly used another person's photograph as his display picture and went by a fake name.

333.title: Alia was a girl, and now, she's a woman: Pooja Bhatt on 'Gangubai...'
333.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has said she watched the first-day first-show of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and heard people whistling in the theatre. "Usually, you don't expect multiplex audiences to whistle...but while watching Gangubai, I heard whistles, screams, yelling," she added. Pooja also praised Alia Bhatt's performance in the film, saying, "She was a girl, and now, she's a woman and she's dazzling."

334.title: Have ensured women feel confident to file complaints: Delhi (Central) DCP
334.article_body: DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan, Central Delhi's first woman DCP in 45 years, in an interview said that there is a need to provide a safe and secure environment to women, for them to realise their full potential. The DCP further said that she has ensured that women feel confident to walk into police stations to lodge complaints.

335.title: Benzema scores hat-trick as Real Madrid knock PSG out of Champions League
335.article_body: Karim Benzema produced a hat-trick as Real Madrid came from being 0-2 down on aggregate to knock PSG out of the Champions League and enter the quarterfinals. Kylian Mbappe's first-half strike put PSG ahead but Benzema's goals in the second half helped Madrid claim 3-1 victory in the second leg on Wednesday night. PSG had won the first-leg 1-0.

336.title: Teacher gets 20-year jail for raping 6-year-old student in Bengaluru
336.article_body: A 46-year-old teacher, Jaishankar, has been sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment and ₹4 lakh fine for raping a six-year-old student in a private school in Bengaluru in 2014. The incident came to light after the minor girl complained of stomachache and was taken to a doctor, after which it was revealed that she was raped in school toilet twice.

337.title: Election Commission is ready for 'One Nation, One Election': CEC Sushil Chandra
337.article_body: 'One Nation One Election' is a good suggestion but it will need a change in the Constitution and it is to be decided in the Parliament, said Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra.  The Election Commission is fully prepared and is capable of conducting simultaneous elections, he added. Chandra said, "According to the Constitution, all the elections should be held simultaneously."

338.title: CCTV image shows Warne walking at Thailand villa moments before his death
338.article_body: A CCTV image has surfaced online showing Australian cricket legend Shane Warne walking at a Thailand villa moments before his death. Warne was walking through the lobby of the villa on the island of Koh Samui after carrying new shirts from his local tailor. Warne passed away due to heart attack aged 52.

339.title: 22-yr-old Ukrainian man charged in ransomware spree extradited to US
339.article_body: A 22-year-old Ukrainian man, Yaroslav Vasinskyi, charged last year with conducting severe ransomware attacks against US targets, has been extradited to the US. Vasinskyi was allegedly behind the July attack against software provider Kaseya. Vasinskyi accessed internal computer networks of several victim companies and deployed Sodinokibi/REvil ransomware to encrypt the data on their computers.

340.title: 1,000 personnel, drones in place as Noida gears up for Assembly poll results
340.article_body: Over 1,000 police personnel, drone cameras and three companies of PAC (Provincial Armed Constabulary) will keep a strict vigil across Gautam Budh Nagar district as the counting of votes for the assembly elections will take place today. The counting of votes for all the three constituencies in GB Nagar will take place at the flower market in Sector 88, Noida.

341.title: Russia may use chemical, biological weapons in Ukraine: US
341.article_body: The US rejected Russian claims that Washington was operating biowarfare labs in Ukraine. "Now that Russia has made these false claims, and China has seemingly endorsed this propaganda, we should all be on...lookout for Russia to possibly use chemical or biological weapons in Ukraine, or to create a false flag operation using them," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said.

342.title: Duplicate cigarette unit busted in Hyd; items worth ₹2 cr seized
342.article_body: A police task force has busted a duplicate cigarette manufacturing unit in Hyderabad's Sultan Bazaar and seized items worth a total of ₹2 crore from the place. The seizure reportedly includes 500 tobacco bags, each weighing about 25 kg, 170 cigarette filter cartons, 400 cigarette paper rolls of various brands and six silver paper rolls. One person has been arrested.

343.title: Ukraine releases intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones
343.article_body: On its official Twitter account, Ukraine released intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones. "These are real intercepted calls...Looting and war crimes included. Please, share! The world must know the truth of what they're doing to our homes and people," Ukraine tweeted. A Russian soldier can be heard saying, "I drank a f***ing cognac worth 7k."

344.title: 25-yr-old man on way to meet girlfriend dies as truck hits him in Mumbai
344.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed after a dumper truck hit his motorcycle and ran over him near Mumbai's Kandivali East on Tuesday. The man reportedly lost control after the truck hit his motorcycle from behind. He fell and was crushed under the truck. Police said that the man was on his way to meet his girlfriend in Dahisar.

345.title: It's still not too late to get into crypto: Mudrex
345.article_body: Crypto startup Mudrex stated that while crypto 'maxis' have been bullish on holding a single coin, Mudrex has emerged with the concept of investing in ideas instead of single coins. Mudrex Coin Sets is the flagship product, letting users invest in expert-created crypto baskets, the company said, adding that it is trusted by over 1,00,000 investors across 100+ countries already.

346.title: Counting of votes for Assembly elections in UP, Punjab, U'khand, Goa & Manipur begins
346.article_body: Counting of votes for Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur state Assemblies has begun. Voting took place in Uttar Pradesh in seven phases and in Manipur in two phases, while Punjab, Uttarakhand and Goa saw one phase of voting each. Counting of post ballot votes has started, the counting of votes polled in EVMs will begin at 8.30 am.

347.title: B'luru doctors successfully transplant woman's kidney on 10-yr-old son
347.article_body: Doctors at Bengaluru's Aster CMI Hospital successfully transplanted a mother's kidney on her 10-year-old son in a six-hour-long surgery. The 41-year-old woman had donated one of her kidneys to her son as he was diagnosed with end-stage renal disease. The boy reportedly started showing uremic symptoms like fatigue, muscle cramps and vomiting with high blood pressure when he was nine-year-old.

348.title: India to bowl first against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, playing XI announced
348.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj won the toss and elected to bowl first against New Zealand in their second 2022 Women's World Cup match at Seddon Park in Hamilton. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Yastika Bhatia replacing Shafali Verma. India have faced New Zealand 53 times in women's ODI cricket, winning 20 times.

349.title: Louis Vuitton hosts its Paris fashion show at Musée d'Orsay museum
349.article_body: High-end luxury fashion label Louis Vuitton took over Musée d'Orsay museum in France to host its Paris fashion show on Monday. The brand's collection showcased models in outsized jackets and shirts layered over colourful dresses as they walked among marble and bronze sculptures. 'Squid Game' actress Hoyeon Jung wore a brown jacket, wide-leg striped pants and a yellow floral tie.

350.title: Told parents to stop reading garbage: Malaika on online trolling
