350.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora while talking about online trolling in a recent interview revealed that her parents get affected by it. "My parents would keep saying, 'beta someone said this or that'. And finally, I sat them down and said, 'Enough! Stop reading...this garbage'," she said. The 48-year-old added that after their talk, the trolling topic never came up again.

351.title: 'Kahaani' helped redefine concept of Indian film heroine: Vidya Balan
351.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has said that her 2012 movie, 'Kahaani', played a "huge role" in redefining "the concept of Indian film heroine". The 43-year-old further called the movie one of her "most special films" as it completed 10 years of its release on Wednesday. "I still remember every day on...shoot. It was like our lives depended on it," she added.

352.title: I lost the dream I had been working on for 18 years: Russia's Mazepin on F1 exit
352.article_body: Former Haas driver Nikita Mazepin on Wednesday said he lost the dream he worked towards for 18 years when he found out he was released by American F1 team Haas following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Haas cut ties with Russian driver Mazepin and title sponsor Uralkali, owned by Mazepin's father Dmitry, who is an associate of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

353.title: Reliance stepping in to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia-Ukraine crisis: Report
353.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd's (RIL) Jamnagar facility is gearing up to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a report said. According to Bloomberg, RIL has deferred maintenance work at Jamnagar plant, and is increasing crude processing in a bid to gain from surge in global demand. It's already sending shipments of fuel to Europe, it said.

354.title: Over 2,500 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Ireland: Minister
354.article_body: Over 2,500 people fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine have arrived in Ireland, with children comprising a third of that number, Irish Justice Minister Helen McEntee said on Wednesday. The Irish government has said Ukrainian refugees will receive medical cards, as well as a Personal Public Service (PPS) number, which will enable them to access certain social welfare benefits.

355.title: Governing bodies of tennis, 4 Grand Slams donate $700,000 to Ukraine
355.article_body: The ATP, WTA and the International Tennis Federation (ITF) along with all four Grand Slams - the Australian Open, Wimbledon, the US Open and the French Open on Wednesday announced a joint donation of $700,000 to Ukraine. All seven bodies have donated $100,000 each to support GlobalGiving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund, which will aid humanitarian relief efforts.

356.title: 25-yr-old man kidnapped for ₹15 lakh ransom found dead in MP forest
356.article_body: A 25-year-old man suffering from paralysis was found dead in a forest in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur after being allegedly abducted for ₹15 lakh ransom. Identified as Rahul Singh, the victim was reportedly found dead in a ditch in Dharampur forest area on Tuesday and his body was decomposed. Police were alerted after the corpse was found by a cattle grazer.

357.title: 3 pubs in Indore sealed for serving liquor to minors
357.article_body: The local administration sealed three pubs in Indore on Wednesday for serving liquor to minors and committing other irregularities, an official said. "These pubs were found serving liquor to children and also operating beyond the administration-fixed deadline of 11.30 pm," Indore Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Akshay Singh Markam said. The pubs stocked liquor beyond permissible limits, he said.

358.title: Russian designer removed from Paris Fashion Week amid Ukraine crisis
358.article_body: France's fashion body, Fédération de la Haute Couture et de la Mode, announced that it has removed Russian designer Valentin Yudashkin from this year's Paris Fashion Week calendar amid the Ukraine crisis. President of the fashion body, Ralph Toledano, said, "If he had doubt about the war in Ukraine, it'd have been hard to remove him...That was not the case."

359.title: I'm working today not because of money but for passion: Akshay Kumar
359.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar in a recent media interaction said that he is working in films today "not because of money" anymore, but "for passion". During the promotion of his next release 'Bachchhan Paandey' on Wednesday, the 54-year-old said, "I choose to go to work in...morning and take...break on Sundays." He added, "The day I feel disinterested...I will stop working."

360.title: There will be infighting in Yadav family after UP polls: Minister
360.article_body: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Wednesday said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is "perplexed and frustrated", adding that infighting within the family will begin after the declaration of State Assembly election results on Thursday. Referring to Yadav's statements on the electronic voting machines (EVMs), Kishore said that the SP chief doesn't have faith in the Election Commission.

361.title: Amit Shah has landed in Goa to buy other party members: Congress
361.article_body: Congress leader Ivan D'Souza on Wednesday levelled horse-trading allegations on BJP ahead of counting of votes for Goa polls. "Amit Shah is already...in Goa and other leaders also landed in Goa...Just to buy the other party members," he added. He said in 2017, Congress was the single-largest party with 17 members and BJP indulged in horse-trading.

362.title: Nadal has to be the favourite going into Indian Wells: Tommy Haas
362.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas said 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is the favourite to win the BNP Paribas Open. "He is, in my opinion, the guy to beat here, there is no doubt about it," Haas said. The current world number four is on a 15-match unbeaten run in 2022 that includes the Australian Open in January.

363.title: Children dying of cancer made to stand in 'Z' shape in snow to support Russia
363.article_body: Terminally ill children at a hospice in Russia were told to stand in the shape of a 'Z' to show support for the invasion of Ukraine. Images posted by Vladimir Vavilov, the chairman of a cancer charity that runs the hospice, show around 60 people gathered in the snow. The letter 'Z' was seen on Russian military equipment in Ukraine.

364.title: Really happy that 'mankad' dismissal has been changed to 'run out': Sachin
364.article_body: Talking about the new cricket rules being introduced by MCC, Sachin Tendulkar said that he is supportive of the 'mankaded' dismissal being changed to 'run-out' category. "I was always uncomfortable with that particular dismissal being called mankaded. I am really happy that it has been changed to run out. It always should have been run out," Sachin added.

365.title: New COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to drop globally: WHO
365.article_body: The World Health Organization on Tuesday said in its weekly report that new COVID-19 cases and deaths continue to drop globally. Compared to the previous week, new cases declined by 5% and deaths declined by 8%. Over 10 million new cases and over 52,000 deaths were reported last week. Only the Western Pacific region reported a 46% increase in cases.

366.title: We know it's going to be a difficult game: Pochettino on Real Madrid
366.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) on Wednesday will face Real Madrid in their UEFA Champions League Round of 16 second-leg tie, which PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino says will be "a difficult game". PSG won the first-leg against Real Madrid 1-0. "The best way to approach the game is to play and attack in the opposition's half," Pochettino said.

367.title: 4 die, 2 seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
367.article_body: At least four people have died and two taken seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's West Champaran and Siwan districts, officials said on Wednesday. According to officials, while one death was reported from Khaptola village under the Nautan police station of West Champaran, three others died in Dhebar village under the Daraundha police station limits of Siwan.

368.title: 16-yr-old girl attempts suicide after father rapes her in UP
368.article_body: A 16-year-old girl attempted suicide after she was allegedly raped by her father in a village under the Khudaganj police station area in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Wednesday. The incident took place on March 5, when the girl's mother had gone out to meet relatives, said Superintendent of Police (Rural) Sanjeev Bajpai. The accused has been arrested.

369.title: UN World Food Programme aims to help over 3 mn Ukrainians: Director
369.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) aims to help over 3 million Ukrainians with food donations, Director General David Beasley said on Wednesday. Beasley made the remark in Poland's Warsaw at a news conference on efforts to support refugees from Ukraine. Over 2 million people have fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion with Poland hosting about 1.2 million of them.

370.title: Russian soldiers let down by appalling leaders: UK Defence Secy
370.article_body: UK's Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Russian soldiers have suffered the heaviest losses since Russia invaded its neighbour Ukraine and have been "let down by appalling leaders". Ukraine has claimed that over 11,000 Russian soldiers, including four commanders, have already been killed. "We can see that the Russians are having real logistical problems," Wallace said.

371.title: Gathering of people outside counting centres banned in Punjab tomorrow
371.article_body: In view of the counting of votes on Thursday, no gathering of people will be allowed outside counting centres in Punjab. Punjab Chief Electoral Officer S Karuna Raju said victory processions are prohibited as well. Only two people can accompany the winning candidate or his official representative to the counting centre to collect the certificate.

372.title: Part of bridge collapses in Odisha; 2 killed & many feared trapped
372.article_body: Two persons were killed and one was injured after a portion of a bridge collapsed at Chhatra Bazar in Odisha's Cuttack on Wednesday evening. Many people are feared trapped on the spot. An investigation will be done and action will be taken against those found responsible for the incident, District Magistrate Bhabani Shankar Chayani said.

373.title: Prabhas thanks Big B, others for lending voice to 'Radhe Shyam'
373.article_body: Actor Prabhas took to social media to share a note for all those who lent their voices for his upcoming movie 'Radhe Shyam'. He posted the note on Instagram, wherein he thanked filmmaker SS Rajamouli and actors Amitabh Bachchan, Prithviraj Sukumaran and Shiva Rajkumar. It further read, "Expressing my gratitude for making this film even more special for us."

374.title: Tiger found dead in MP's tiger reserve, territorial fight suspected
374.article_body: An adult tiger was found dead in the Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcass of the feline, around 12 years old, was said to have been found with multiple injury marks and it was suspected that the animal died in a territorial fight. It was disposed of as per the National Tiger Conservation Authority guidelines.

375.title: PM thanks Hungary's PM for facilitating 6,000 Indians' evacuation
375.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke with his Hungarian counterpart His Excellency Viktor Orban and thanked him for facilitating the evacuation of over 6,000 Indians through the Ukraine-Hungary border. "PM Orban...said that Indian medical students could choose to continue their studies in Hungary if they wished," PMO said. The duo also discussed the situation in Ukraine.

376.title: Kids buried under wreckage as Russian strike hits hospital, Ukraine Prez shares video
376.article_body: Ukrainian officials said a Russian strike has hit a children's hospital and maternity facility in the besieged southeastern port city of Mariupol. A statement on the city council's social media account on Wednesday said the hospital suffered "colossal" damage. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted that there were "people, children under the wreckage" while sharing a video.

377.title: 18 injured, 4 died during Manipur polls amid high turnout: Report
377.article_body: A total of 18 people have been injured and four have died during the Manipur elections amid a high turnout of voters, according to reports. The EVMs and polling teams were airlifted after three helicopters, including one ALH of Global Vectra and one MI17 of IAF were deployed. The injured people and security forces were reportedly given cashless treatment.

378.title: McDonald's says closing stores in Russia will cost it $50 mn per month
378.article_body: McDonald's on Wednesday said closing stores in Russia in response to the Russia-Ukraine war will cost the fast food chain $50 million a month. McDonald's owns 84% of its Russian locations itself and said it'll continue to pay its 62,000 staff and restaurant employees in Russia. "This is a really challenging and complex situation for...us," said McDonald's CFO Kevin Ozan.

379.title: 6 killed, 3 injured in head-on collision between truck & car in UP
379.article_body: Six men were killed and three were left with critical injuries in a head-on collision between a mini-truck and a car on the Etawah-Mainpuri road in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The crash took place on Wednesday when a group of people from Jaswantnagar area were on their way to attend a function. The injured were admitted to the hospital.

380.title: Germany certainly not sending warplanes to Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
380.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said that the country certainly won't send warplanes to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. Scholz's comments came after US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its Russian-made MiG-29 jets to a US base in Germany. "We've provided all kinds of defence materials [to Ukraine] and...sent weapons...but...we have to consider very carefully what we do [next]," Scholz said.

381.title: 3 FIRs filed after confrontation in Mangaluru college over hijab
381.article_body: Three FIRs have been registered in Mangaluru following a confrontation between two student groups over wearing hijab during examination at a college. This comes as Karnataka High Court is yet to announce its verdict over ban on hijab in educational institutions. Police said "one case is registered on a female student's complaint against some other students and 15 ABVP members."

382.title: 22-yr-old cricketer Rahul Chahar marries longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa, shares pics
382.article_body: Cricketer Rahul Chahar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa on Wednesday. He took to Instagram to share pictures, writing, "Our Happily ever after." Rahul and Ishani had got engaged in December 2019. The 22-year-old leg-spinner, who was part of India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, was bought by Punjab Kings in IPL mega auction last month.

383.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1,984 crore in Karvy Stock Broking scam
383.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday said it has attached immovable and movable properties worth ₹1,984 crore belonging to Karvy Stock Broking, its Chairman Comandur Parthasarathy and others in a money laundering case. Attached properties include landed properties worth ₹213.6 crore, tangible/intangible assets worth ₹1,280 crore and Parthasarathy's shareholding worth ₹438.7 crore, ED said.

384.title: 4 robbers distract Guj trader in car, escape with bag containing ₹15 lakh
384.article_body: Four robbers stole a bag containing ₹15 lakhs from the car of a trader in Gujarat's Morbi town on Tuesday. However, two of the accused were caught in Rajkot, while the two others managed to escape. The accused, with the help of a boy, were able to distract the trader and escaped with the bag full of cash.

385.title: Congo militiamen kill 18 civilians in church compound: Report
385.article_body: Militiamen have killed 18 civilians in a church compound in Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday, a witness and a local human rights groups said. The civilians were sleeping in the church outbuildings when the attack took place in Banyali Kilo district in the Ituri province, according to a report. They had reportedly fled there after escaping from previous attacks.

386.title: Women hold topless protest against Russia in front of Eiffel Tower; video surfaces
386.article_body: Women part of a feminist group held a topless protest in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris to protest against Russian invasion of Ukraine. The video of the protest shows their chests painted with colours of the Ukrainian flag and slogans like 'Stop Putin's War', 'Feminists against War' and 'Slava Ukraini' written on them.

387.title: Highly dangerous: Karti on Indian student fighting for Ukraine
387.article_body: On reports that a 21-year-old student from Tamil Nadu will fight for Ukraine against Russia, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said that this is highly dangerous. "Imagine if a Muslim youth from Coimbatore goes to Syria and fights against Assad. Wouldn't he be called a Jihadi?" he asked. "I don't agree with citizens of other nations joining the war," he added.

388.title: Sarpanch shot dead near Srinagar in J&K, 2nd incident in 1 week
388.article_body: A village sarpanch was shot dead by suspected terrorists on the outskirts of Srinagar in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The victim has been identified as Sameer Ahmad Bhat, the sarpanch of the Khanmoh area. This is the second such incident in a week as a panchayat member in Kulgam district was shot dead by terrorists last Wednesday.

389.title: Kidnapped Bihar businessman rescued, 7 members of gang arrested
389.article_body: The Rohtas Police on Tuesday rescued a businessman from a locked house at Kudra in Bihar's Kaimur district, who was kidnapped on March 5 by an interstate gang, officials said. The kidnappers had demanded a ₹1.5 crore ransom, but the police rescued him and arrested seven members of the gang and recovered an SUV, pistol used in the crime.

390.title: Have ensured peaceful voting, will ensure peaceful counting: UP ADG
390.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for the ongoing Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Additional Director General of Police (law and order) Prashant Kumar said, "We have ensured peaceful voting, we will ensure peaceful counting also". He also said that 70,000 civil police workers, 245 companies of paramilitary forces and 69 company PSE commanders have been deployed for March 10.

391.title: Man who got world's 1st pig heart transplant dies after 2 months in US
391.article_body: The first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig has died two months after the surgery, the US hospital that performed the surgery announced on Wednesday. While doctors didn't give an exact cause of death, they said 57-year-old David Bennett's condition had begun deteriorating several days earlier. He got a transplant from a genetically modified pig.

392.title: Cong doesn't trust them: Goa CM after party moves candidates to resort
392.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has said that Congress doesn't trust its candidates after the party reportedly moved its candidates to a resort ahead of Assembly election results. "[Congress is] keeping [candidates] in isolation...without knowing who's winning," he added. Reacting to the possibility of hung Assembly, Sawant said independent candidates will back BJP if it falls short of a majority.

393.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of holding 4,00,000 'hostage' in Mariupol
393.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday accused Russia of holding 4,00,000 people 'hostage' in Mariupol and blocking humanitarian aid and evacuation. He took to Twitter and said that almost 3,000 newborn babies lack medicine and food in the city. "I urge the world to act! Force Russia to stop its barbaric war on civilians and babies!" the minister added.

394.title: Redmi launches Note 11 Pro series & Redmi Watch 2 Lite in India today
394.article_body: All-new Redmi Note 11 Pro+ 5G and Redmi Note 11 Pro were launched today. The latest Redmi Note devices that sport 67W Turbo charging promise a full day's charge in just 15 minutes. Redmi also launched Redmi Watch 2 Lite alongside the two smartphones in what was Xiaomi's first on-ground tech launch event of 2022.

395.title: Woman with 2 uteruses gives birth to 2 babies in a year in US, pic surfaces
395.article_body: A woman from Georgia, US gave birth to two babies in one year, as they each grew in her two different uteruses. Caroline Wortman, 30, discovered she was nearly ten weeks pregnant with her second child, just six months after her daughter's birth. She suffers from a rare condition called uterine didelphys, meaning she was born with two reproductive systems.

396.title: World no. 2 Djokovic added to Indian Wells draw despite vaccine status
396.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has been added to the Indian Wells draw despite doubts whether he can play in the US event due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated to enter the country. Djokovic, who was deported from Australia due to his vaccine status, recently revealed he remains unvaccinated.

397.title: FIFA suspend Ukraine’s WC playoff against Scotland amid war with Russia
397.article_body: FIFA on Tuesday said it suspended Ukraine's World Cup qualifying playoff match against Scotland following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The match was scheduled to be played on March 24. FIFA added Poland has received a bye through their playoff match against Russia that was scheduled to be played the same day. Ukraine's match with Scotland will be organised in June.

398.title: We're going to get clear majority in Goa polls: Cong's Chidambaram
398.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram expressed confidence in the party's victory in the Goa Assembly elections and stated that Congress is going to get a "clear majority". Chidambaram's comment comes after Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar claimed that talks are underway with Aam Aadmi Party to obtain support for government formation. Exit polls have predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

399.title: Ukraine warns of risk of radiation leak after power cut at Chernobyl nuclear plant
399.article_body: Ukrainian nuclear company Energoatom has warned of radiation leak from the occupied Chernobyl nuclear power plant because it cannot cool spent nuclear fuel due to power cut. "The radioactive cloud could be carried by wind to other regions of Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, and Europe," it added. Ukraine has appealed to Russia for a temporary ceasefire to repair the power line.

400.title: Puducherry minister dresses as Goddess, says, 'Knew there'll be -ve feedback'
400.article_body: A video of Puducherry minister S Chandira Priyanga dressed as Goddess was released on Women's Day. After the clip got criticism from few, she said she knew there'll be negative feedback but doesn't care about it. "It's not like putting just another get-up...I underwent fasting and stopped eating non-vegetarian food as I feel this is a sacred thing," she said.

401.title: Upper age limit for appearing in NEET-UG examination removed
401.article_body: Upper age limit for appearing in the undergraduate medical entrance exam, NEET-UG, has been removed for all candidates, the National Medical Commission has said. Earlier, the age limit was 25 years for General category candidates and 30 years for Reserved category candidates. The decision was taken in the fourth NMC meeting held in October last year, the commission's secretary said.

402.title: Sreesanth retires from all forms of Indian domestic cricket
402.article_body: Cricketer Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket aged 39. In a video posted on Twitter, Sreesanth said he's looking forward to be a part of a coaching setup and also expressed his interest in playing leagues across the globe once BCCI allows. Sreesanth's seven-year ban over IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal had ended in September 2020.

403.title: 20,000 foreigners joined Ukraine forces to fight against Russia: Report
403.article_body: Around 20,000 foreigners have joined Ukrainian forces to fight against Russia amid the ongoing war, The Kyiv Independent reported. "Foreign volunteers will be able to obtain Ukrainian citizenship if they want to," it quoted Ukraine's First Deputy Interior Minister Yevhen Yenin as saying. There have been reports of citizens of various nations, including India, volunteering to fight for Ukraine.
